story:
Summary

Over the past thirteen years, American Airlines Sky Ball, in support of the Airpower Foundation, has grown into a nationally recognized event.  No other event in the country matches the size and scope of American Airlines Sky Ball! 

This year Sky Ball will honor all those who served in Vietnam while recognizing the 50th anniversary of the start of America's involvement in the war and will salute the United States Air Force!  Our fundraising goal is to raise $1 for each of the 2.5 million service members who served during Vietnam.  The Airpower Foundation is also honored to be a partner with the Department of Defense and the 50th Anniversary Vietnam War Commemorative program. 

American Airlines Sky Ball has grown from a one night fundraiser into three (3) days of honoring all of our nation's military.  During the weekend, educational opportunities are provided for students at local area schools with STEM education and the once in a lifetime opportunity to meet and hear from our Medal of Honor Recipient guests who visit the schools along with additional services members, entertainers, and scientists highlighting groundbreaking technological devices.  An educational workshop is provided for teachers to learn the Medal of Honor Foundation's Character Development Program which incorporates the ideals of courage and selfless service into the middle and high school curriculum to build character and promote responsible citizenship.  Our partnership with the Medal of Honor Foundation has grown to hosting their Bob Hope Award Gala Thursday evening.  On Friday the Non-Commissioned Officers Association will host a career expo to assist military members and their families find exciting career opportunities from over 50 companies who will be present. Friday evening we will be hosting a donated concert at DFW International Airport inside American Airlines Hangar Number 5, the home of American Airlines Sky Ball!  This year Budweiser is presenting the "Here's to the Heroes" concert headlined by International music sensation Pitbull.  The concert will also feature a special performance by Singer, Ventriloquist, Impressionist, and Comedian Terry Fator! 4,000 military members will be our guests for the show where they will also enjoy a fabulous meal prepared by celebrity Chef Robert Irvine and his amazing culinary team to include military chefs from the White House and Pentagon who will be flown in on a special Envoy Airlines charter flight from Washington D.C.  Other special guests traveling on the charter flight will include wounded service members from Walter Reed Bethesda Medical Center who will be our VIP guests for the weekend.  Overnight the hangar is transformed from a concert venue into a Black Tie fundraising gala thanks to our nearly 1,300 volunteers who all make this weekend possible.  Thanks to our audio visual partner PSAV, the hangar will be an audio visual experience like no other for all of our guests to enjoy as we tell the story of the U.S. Air Force and honor our Vietnam Veterans as the welcome home event of a lifetime for all those in attendance to include a special performance by legendary artist Tony Orlando.  Gary Sinise and the Lt. Dan Band will perform to close the evenings festivities!  Actors John Ratzenberger and Dale Dye along with celebrity Chef Robert Irvine will also be joining us at American Airlines Sky Ball XIII.

What We Need 

The goal of our campaign is to raise $2.5 million dollars.  Your donation will allow the Airpower Foundation to further support our nation's military, their families, wounded service members, and the children of our fallen military heroes.  The Airpower Foundation prides itself on funding programs nationwide which directly support those who need it most.  The charities and organizations we are able to support through American Airlines Sky Ball and your donations include:

  • Snowball Express - Serving the children of our fallen Military heroes
  • The Gary Sinise Foundation - Building smart homes for our nations most severely wounded warriors
  • The Medal of Honor Foundation - Promotes American values and the qualities of courage, sacrifice and patriotism through increased awareness, education, behavior and example
  • Salute to the Troops - A Veterans Day weekend celebration for Wounded Warriors in Las Vegas
  • Heroes on the Water - Kayak fishing trips across the country for wounded warrior support and healing
  • Thanks USA - Scholarships for Military families
  • Carrick Brain Center - Treating wounded service members suffering from PTS and TBI
  • Brain Treatment Center of America - Treating wounded service members suffering from PTS and TBI

In addition to our national charity partners, the Airpower Foundation accepts grant requests from around the country from those in need and carefully reviews each one to ensure every dollar raised is going to deserving organizations and individuals who need it most.  


    The Impact

    The efforts of the Airpower Foundation has positively effected the lives of thousands of service members, wounded warriors, their families, and the families of our fallen military heroes across the country.  With your additional support we can extend the assistance we can offer through our extensive network of the most reputable military support organizations in the nation.  Thank you for your support of all who serve.
story_txt:
Summary
Over
the past thirteen years, American Airlines Sky Ball, in support of the Airpower
Foundation, has grown into a nationally recognized event.  No other event
in the country matches the size and scope of American Airlines Sky Ball! 
This
year Sky Ball will honor all those who served in Vietnam while recognizing the
50th anniversary of the start of America's involvement in the war and will
salute the United States Air Force!  Our fundraising goal is to raise $1
for each of the 2.5 million service members who served during Vietnam.
 The Airpower Foundation is also honored to be a partner with the
Department of Defense and the 50th Anniversary Vietnam War Commemorative
program. 
American
Airlines Sky Ball has grown from a one night fundraiser into three (3) days of
honoring all of our nation's military.  During the weekend, educational
opportunities are provided for students at local area schools with STEM
education and the once in a lifetime opportunity to meet and hear from our
Medal of Honor Recipient guests who visit the schools along with additional
services members, entertainers, and scientists highlighting groundbreaking technological
devices.  An educational workshop is provided for teachers to learn the
Medal of Honor Foundation's Character Development Program which incorporates
the ideals of courage and selfless service into the middle and high school
curriculum to build character and promote responsible citizenship.  Our
partnership with the Medal of Honor Foundation has grown to hosting their Bob
Hope Award Gala Thursday evening.  On Friday the Non-Commissioned Officers
Association will host a career expo to assist military members and their
families find exciting career opportunities from over 50 companies who will be
present. Friday evening we will be hosting a donated concert at DFW
International Airport inside American Airlines Hangar Number 5, the home of
American Airlines Sky Ball!  This year Budweiser is presenting the
"Here's to the Heroes" concert headlined by International music
sensation Pitbull.  The concert will also feature a special performance by
Singer, Ventriloquist, Impressionist, and Comedian Terry Fator! 4,000 military
members will be our guests for the show where they will also enjoy a fabulous
meal prepared by celebrity Chef Robert Irvine and his amazing culinary team to
include military chefs from the White House and Pentagon who will be flown in on
a special Envoy Airlines charter flight from Washington D.C.  Other
special guests traveling on the charter flight will include wounded service
members from Walter Reed Bethesda Medical Center who will be our VIP guests for
the weekend.  Overnight the hangar is transformed from a concert venue
into a Black Tie fundraising gala thanks to our nearly 1,300 volunteers who all
make this weekend possible.  Thanks to our audio visual partner PSAV, the
hangar will be an audio visual experience like no other for all of our guests
to enjoy as we tell the story of the U.S. Air Force and honor our Vietnam
Veterans as the welcome home event of a lifetime for all those in attendance to
include a special performance by legendary artist Tony Orlando.  Gary
Sinise and the Lt. Dan Band will perform to close the evenings festivities!
 Actors John Ratzenberger and Dale Dye along with celebrity Chef Robert
Irvine will also be joining us at American Airlines Sky Ball XIII.
  What We Need 
The
goal of our campaign is to raise $2.5 million dollars.  Your donation will
allow the Airpower Foundation to further support our nation's military, their
families, wounded service members, and the children of our fallen military
heroes.  The Airpower Foundation prides itself on funding programs
nationwide which directly support those who need it most.  The charities
and organizations we are able to support through American Airlines Sky Ball and
your donations include:

Snowball Express - Serving the children of our fallen
     Military heroes
The Gary Sinise Foundation - Building smart homes for
     our nations most severely wounded warriors
The Medal of Honor Foundation - Promotes American
     values and the qualities of courage, sacrifice and patriotism through increased
     awareness, education, behavior and example
Salute to the Troops - A Veterans Day weekend
     celebration for Wounded Warriors in Las Vegas
Heroes on the Water - Kayak fishing trips across the
     country for wounded warrior support and healing
Thanks USA - Scholarships for Military families
Carrick Brain Center - Treating wounded service members
     suffering from PTS and TBI
Brain Treatment Center of America - Treating wounded
     service members suffering from PTS and TBI

In
addition to our national charity partners, the Airpower Foundation accepts
grant requests from around the country from those in need and carefully reviews
each one to ensure every dollar raised is going to deserving organizations and
individuals who need it most.  
   The Impact
The
efforts of the Airpower Foundation has positively effected the lives of
thousands of service members, wounded warriors, their families, and the
families of our fallen military heroes across the country.  With your
additional support we can extend the assistance we can offer through our
extensive network of the most reputable military support organizations in the
nation.  Thank you for your support of all who serve.

story:
The Idea

We are some aspiring web designers, graphic designers and translators who are optimistic about establishing a full-fledged, state-of-the-art ‘Multimedia and Advertising Studio’ here in Bulgaria. This is a very rare initiative to establish something of this sort in our poverty ridden region.

We believe that this initiative will create employment for our young people who roam about the streets in search of a job.Therefore we decided to hire only Kids and young abdults, younger than 29 years old, even if they are less educated - we will take care of this if they are willing to learn.  We also believe that this initiative will also help our community to be more developed and modernized. By understanding the significance of this initiative, our government has provided a primary fund to accommodate the cost of the equipment and salaries of the 9 employees for a year. But in order to get going and fulfill our dream of developing the region, provide our youths with employment, we need more funds and that’s where we seek your utmost attention.

What we want to do

The purpose of this initiative is to establish a creative multimedia and advertising agency. The firm will be offering various services such as designing, filming, programming, professional writing, and translating. It should be mentioned that we will be serving the clients of our country as well as the clients in foreign countries and hence it is very important for us to set up a suitable workplace here in Bulgaria. Our firm will work as a creative agency that will have a printing department, a designing department, a programming department, and a writing and translation department. According to our initial estimation, we will be needing 9 employees to offer all the mentioned services. For this, we are planning to hire talented young people who excel in their respective fields.

The hired employees’ compensation/salary is being taken care of from the EU/Government granted fund. But, as the current monthly salary is very minimal (less than 300 Euro/350 USD), it is very difficult to attract young and talented people to work for us. Hence, we need to offer a lucrative amount to attract the potential employees.

One might ask, “Why does a creative agency need translators?". Well, to answer this question, we must project the potentials first. Bulgaria is a country with just over 7 million people and it hasn’t been able to provide sufficient numbers of translators yet. As translating service has a high demand and many foreign clients are asking for this service, it is very logical to hire a translator for our firm.


What we have and what we need

We have taken care of the minimal salaries for a year, basic equipment like Furniture, Computers, Cameras and even a Drone. We have also managed some studio and printing equipment. We have also started promoting our initiative through various marketing channels. So far, all these investment total around 48,000 EUR / $55,000. We have also managed a suitable office space (which has an area more than 1000 square feet) at a monthly rent of 300 Euro / $350. Still, we need some funds for office supplies, decoration, and day to day operating cost for the first year of operation. As we are hoping that our business will break-even in the following year, these are some of the expenses we need to take care off for the first year.

Operating Expenses

3700 EUR/4200 USD for the Rent

10000 EUR/ 11200 USD for offering lucrative salaries

3000 EUR/3400 USD for Utility

4000 EUR/ 4500 USD for Insurances

3000 EUR / 3400 USD for Additional Marketing

We would also need the following equipment.

Item

Cost

Plotting and Printing equipment

3000 EUR/3400 USD

Software licenses

5000 EUR/5600 USD

Additional Studio equipment

2000 EUR/2200 USD

We also need the following things, provided that we get enough funding for the previous ones.

Item

Cost

A used Car

5000 EUR/5600 USD

A nice LED/Metal Sign

1000 EUR /1100 USD

Billboard on the main road

2500 EUR/2800 USD

Others

1000 Euro

Remember, every dollar and every euro counts.

Risks / Challenges

Our first challenge will be to find qualified and talented employees. There are not many SEO-Experts, 3D-animators and expert designers in a town of 10000 people. So, we have to recruit people from nearby towns. We hope to get employees directly from the University of Veliko Turnovo. We believe that the fresh graduates from this institutions will be able to bring expertise and enthusiasm in the workplace. We should also acknowledge that due to our limited human resource, we will not be able to take care of all the appointed jobs of our own. Hence, we will outsource some of our responsibilities to experts working in the modern Capital of Bulgaria, Sofia or other Big Towns. We are confident that we will be able to manage all the responsibilities and help our region grow both in terms of skills and expertise.

A very small but crucial piece of information; our initiative will not be facing any harsh competitions in the region and hence the probability of success is very high for us.

Your donation can make a difference

So why should you support us? Your donation, even a small one, helps to get a less developed region closer to the modern world. Your donation also gets young people to have a job in their region, even in their hometown. By donating for this initiative, you will be contributing to the development of this very country, Bulgaria.

You will also show people, that they aren't left alone, cut off from the world. You will be able to reach the rural people and make them understand the beauty and usefulness of this strange thing called "The Internet" and the community behind it. You will also introduce them with some enthusiastic people who are willing to achieve something amazing for themselves, for the community, and for the country.

We will be grateful to you for your contribution. For a small amount of donation, you get great gestures of gratitude and for a little more, you get things that can really help your business identity to grow or give your personal appearance a glow. 

Other ways you can help

If you cannot support us financially, there are other ways you can help us with. If you believe that our project is aspiring and goal-oriented, please share about it with your near and dear ones. Spread the word using social media channels such as Facebook, Twitter etc. You can also help us by placing orders with us for services like Web Designing, Search Engine Optimization, Writing and Translation etc. Please check out our website to learn more about us. Thank you!

story:
In the Media


   




Fishing, as an active and healthy lifestyle has won the hearts of millions of people. We are one of them. We have created Fishing FanCam also for the promotion of this kind of vacation.



Fishing FanCam is a high-tech device that will satisfy curiosity of any angler.

The device will be interesting for all fishermen, even the children, and professionals.



Fishing FanCam designed to observe the fish in its natural environment, watch it’s behavior and reaction to the bait in real time.

Fishing FanCam is maximally compact and mobile. You can observe underwater space almost continuously with help of removable and accessible battery.



Fishing FanCam is unique device, it provides direct fish watching in a real-time and broadcast video in HD quality to your mobile device.


*We can change inessential features to make your gadget better.


We take care about the use of the advanced and reliable data transmission technologies.



Use the mobile application for IOS & Android to view, save or share the video.

You can also search an object of fishing in unfamiliar place and check your own understanding of "fish psychology".

You can save the video to your mobile device and share it with your friends using free mobile application.



In this project, we invite all who wish to pre-order our device at an unbeatable price. Pre-order Fishing FanCam and become the owner of hightech device one of the first, before mass selling starts.




The first my trophy i fished out when i was six years old. It was an unforgettable experience that has predetermined my hobby for the rest of my life.

Later, when I was 8, Electronics became my second hobby which turned into my profession and I succeed in it.

With my colleagues we always followed the fishermen idea «catch and release» and our curiosity, that’s why we have invented our Fishing FanCam.



Our team has several years of experience in the development of various gadgets. We have experience in computer vision algorithms, Bluetooth, Wi-Fi technology, software development and industrial 3D design.

The experience gained by us in the development, production and support of a wide range of equipment, contacts with manufacturers of components, knowledge of technology and electronics market allows us to guarantee settlement of all tasks to the realization of our plan.


Risks & Challenges

We’ve got all resources for making the gadget of high quality with your help. We plan to use the most innovative technologies from facility market. However we need significant investments for making high-quality and rugged item.

Nowadays we are at the beta-test level. Our team sees at least 3 ways of producing of our project  and it depends on results of this company. Probably, we will change some insignificant features of out gadget, but only in the case of improving final usage. We will inform you about every particular change.

We’ve already got some experience in the developing wearable devices which are connected with wireless data transfer. We understand risk of developing, producing and delivery of such kind of project. That’s why we state jail time of our project and plan to state mange manufacturing logistics and delivery. Our team is grateful for giving credence to us!


Statement of warranty

We respect everyone who supports us, that’s why:

We provide with 1-year warranty.

We warrant full return in case you receive a gadget which has a significant difference from the declared project.

story:
Welcome to EARTH.

Welcome to Earth. And the future home of the School of Embodied Poetics.

This is the perfect place to sit in your own skin, feel the beauty of your nature, and evolve the courage it takes to become the YOU you have always known you could be.

This is an inspired collaboration…

Acquaintances turned friends, turned sisters, turned collaborators, that’s us, the Shakti team of Shannon Paige and Sara Shirk.

In a process of distinct evolution, continued study and revolutionary execution of a deeply practiced, fully embodied, and transmittable methodology and related bodies of work; Shannon and Sara strive to tune, teach, and transmit the Embody Method. This method moves the students’ mental, emotional and physical awareness from simple stabilizing actions into ever evolving complex forms and sequences to unfold meaning, confident and stable expression, and positive change.

The Embody Method has given way to the School of Embodied Poetics which is the home to several related bodies of work: Anjali Restorative Yoga, Shanti Shakti: Integrative Slow Flow, and Bala Therapeutic Yoga.

In order to give us the ability to reach as many inspired students and practitioners as possible we must give our school a stable and solid home.  That is why we are seeking to set down roots and create EARTH. 

EARTH is not simply a yoga studio, it is a place where every yoga student, practitioner, seeker, and aspiring teacher is invited to explore the melding of science and ancient wisdom traditions with the fullness of embodied poetry. 

Your contributions will go to cover the cost of build-out, construction, and supplies: flooring, paint, lighting, shelving, computer, yoga mats and props.

If you're totally strapped for cash, no worries!  Sharing our mission on your favorite flavor of social media:  Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Google+, Tumblr, Pinterest, Youtube, etc. helps us out as well! 

Any and all support is invaluable for our effort.

Thank you for reading and sharing our story.

We look forward to seeing you at the school you helped build very soon!

story:
Education is our passport to the future, for tomorrow belongs to the people who prepare for it today. — Malcolm X 

Education is the only way to safeguard a child's future. Help to improve the lives of Syrian refugees by providing Backpacks and stationary with Only 10$ or 300$ to pay the fees of one semester for a Syrian refugee in Lebanon.

story:
Our Story.

Greetings all good people. My name is Ken Strang, the Founder of The Retsogile Permaculture Education & Training Trust and I'm here to invite you to join me on an incredible journey of giving.



Life threw me a curve-ball in the form of failing health and I was put-out-to-pasture. After receiving my pension pay-out and taking a hard look as to ''where to now'' I found myself in the enviable position of having more than I needed for the time I had left. I then realised that, at last, I could be the change I want to see, I could contribute positively, I could give back. There is no doubt in my mind that my generation (baby-boomers and siblings) have been the greatest consumers of all time and that we have a debt to repay, a responsibility to repair the damage we have done.

I am a great believer in the Permaculture way which will not only help alleviate poverty through providing people with the means to feed themselves sustainably but is also a climate change mitigation method in that all the plants extract carbon from the air and fix it back into the soil. People Care! Earth Care! Fair Share!


With this goal in mind, I have started a new and exciting final journey of my life, a rewarding journey that I invite you to join me on. I have dedicated half my pension monies and half my farm, complete with full infrastructure, to this cause. I have established a charitable non-profit Trust, The Retsogile Permaculture Education & Training Trust. A legally constituted and registered NPO dedicated to improving the lives of the poor rural folk in South Africa. The word Retsogile is a Sepedi (North Sotho) word meaning ‘’we are standing up’’, ‘’we are getting to work’’. (Pronounced Ret-sue-g-wheelie with the g being gutteral)


The Trust is a collective of like-minded young people who are concerned with the ever increasing level of poverty in South Africa and food security for their families.

Please allow me to introduce the Trustees.

Corle, Shannna, Linah, Cobus and Kyle.

...and the current team


Front:  Maria, Grace, Rose (1), Magdalene, Queen. (Workers)

Back: Andre'. Rose (2). Xola and Anthony. (Volunteers)



...and the kiddies...we involve them in everything so they are also team members.


OPERATION.

The Trust will operate in a dual mode, being a profitable business and an NPO side by side;

1. Profitable.

  i. Training.

  ii. Demonstration Site.

  iii. Venue hire.

2. NPO.

  i. Profits from above.

  ii. Donors and sponsorships.


GOALS.

  1. Raising funds through profitable training programmes and donors and which funds will be used to provide free education and training to subsistence farmers to assist them in increasing their yields and varieties sustainably;

  2. To establish food gardens in rural schools to add value to the School Feeding Scheme (this will have the added benefit of exposing the students to the ethics of Permaculture and teaching the students to grow food), and;

  3. To embark on community outreach programmes in the field of Early Childhood Development by assisting and training educators and care-givers.

BENEFITS.

The benefits to the rural poor are enormous. Their communal lands are decimated after generations of unsustainable farming methods. The topsoil is all but gone, but, thankfully, the lands have never been poisoned by chemicals and therefore can easily be regenerated.  All that is needed is knowledge, guidance and assistance which we aim to provide. We will regenerate the land, redesign it on contour and install water harvesting swales complete with beneficial plants. We will also establish the foundations of food forests in marginal lands. This will give the communities the food security they so desperately need. Our starting point is the Segwashi community and our goal is one communal land per annum.


Just as a child should not go to bed hungry, so too, a child cannot learn on an empty stomach. We will establish food gardens in poor rural schools to add value, in the form of fresh vegetables and fruit, to the current government school feeding scheme. We will teach the children from a young age the importance of healthy food and how to grow it and the need to respect and care for the Earth and all its life forms. This will help to develop a generation that will change the way we treat the Earth and each other, a caring generation. Our starting point is Glenshiel Primary School, where we have already started, and Segwashi Primary School and our goal is one school food garden every six months.


Many elderly folk are caring for their children’s children on their meagre pensions and therefore most of these children do not have any pre-school guidance and tuition. We aim to change this by establishing pre-school centres and assisting and training educators and care-givers in Early Childhood Development. This will have the benefit of the timely development of motor skills and other important aspects of their development as well as identify any shortfalls early in their development so that these can be concentrated on. Our starting point is the Segwashi community and our goal is one pre-school per annum.


ACHIEVE GOAL 1.

How do we plan to achieve our first goal?

  1. We will provide free training to subsistence farmers and equip them with the necessary knowledge and skills required to farm sustainably.

  2. We will provide financial and practical assistance to subsistence farmers to repair and regenerate their lands and to implement a relevant Permaculture design to their lands to ensure the sustainability of said lands. This will require installing water-harvesting swales (ditches or depressions) on contour every 20 meters and planting the berms with beneficial plants such as nitrogen fixers and dynamic accumulators.

  3. Our starting point is the Segwashi community and our goal is one communal land per annum.


ACHIEVE GOAL 2.

How do we plan to achieve our second goal?

  1. We will conduct school tours on the demonstration site to expose the learners to all aspects of sustainable living and farming. Here they will witness alternate energy sources such as wind and solar as well as bio-gas from manure. They will also experience correct and humane animal husbandry methods, contour farming, mulch application, seed collection and storage, soil preservation and regeneration techniques, water-harvesting techniques and much more.

  2. We will establish food gardens in schools according to the Permaculture methodology and will involve the educators and learners in these projects from day one ensuring the transfer of the necessary skills and knowledge at an early stage of the learner’s development.

  3. We will assist in maintaining these gardens by conducting weekly workshops on site. This will provide us with the opportunity to impart the necessary knowledge and skills required to rectify any short-comings and/or reverse any problems, such as diseases, that may occur.

  4. Our starting point is the Glenshiel (already started) and Segwashi Primary Schools and our goal is one school garden every six months.


ACHIEVE GOAL 3.

How do we plan to achieve our third goal?

  1. We will provide assistance to teachers through a qualified Early Childhood Development educator to help improve their teaching methods, if so needed, after observation of lessons given by the teachers. The ECD educator will also advise of any new or improved techniques that may be developed.

  2. We aim to establish proper pre-school centres equipped with the necessary tools required to provide toddlers with a proper education in their critical formative years. To ensure this we will train pre-school teachers and care-givers on site and seek bursaries and/or sponsorships for those that are capable and show promise.

Our starting point is the Segwashi community and our goal is one pre-school per annum.

 Obviously we would like to achieve more but we prefer to set realistic and    achievable goals. progress will depend on funding!

What We Need & What You Get

I have already contributed ZAR159 991.00 (USD12 307.00) being;

1. Legal fees for the establishment of the Trust =ZAR32 000 (USD2462.)

2. Permaculture design for farm = ZAR22 300.00 (USD1716.)

3. Teepee for budget accommodation = ZAR14 500.00 (USD1116.)

4. Consulting Arborist = ZAR30 000.00 (USD2308.)

5. Staff remuneration to end September = ZAR61 191 (USD4707)

Further to this, should we be successful in our fundraiser my attorney will deposit a further contribution from me of R100 000 (USD7693), which he is holding in trust for this purpose, into the Trust's bank account.


BUT…

The Trust is in need of two final projects to complete the first phase of its development and become fully operational, that of a functional training centre and student accommodation. We need a boost to get the project up and running and I invite you to assist in this by contributing towards the US$14000 needed to upgrade the existing accommodation quarters and equip the training centre. We are setting a goal of US$20,000 which will go towards paying critical staff such as the manager/trainer, fundraiser/marketer and one support staff for three months. This excludes me… my time and effort is free to the Trust and the results will be my reward.


The budget is as follows:

HOSTEL.

Upgrading of existing structure

R 89 000,00

$6 846,15

Furniture and fittings

R20 000,00

$1 538,46

Composting toilet

R 6 000,00

$461,54

Total

R115 000,00

$8 846,15

TRAINING CENTRE & OFFICE.

Projector & accessories

R 5 000,00

$384,62

Posters

R 3 000,00

$230,77

Furniture

R 10 000,00

$769,23

Stationary

R 4 000,00

$307,69

Whiteboard and flipchart

R 2 000,00

$153,85

4 in 1 Printer

R 4 000,00

$307,69

Total

R 28 000,00

$4 307,69

Grand total

R143000,00

$13 153,85

SALARIES.

Manager/Trainer (3 months)

R 45 000,00

$3 461,54

Marketer/Fundraiser (3 months)

R 21 000,00

$1 615,38

Support Staff x 1 (3 months)

R 12 000,00

$923,08

Total

R 78 000,00

$6 000,00

Grand Total

R221000,00

$19 153,85

For your contribution we will return the gesture with a little gift. Check out our perks as they are uniquely African flavoured.


The Impact

Our food security is at risk. Most agricultural land has become food deserts with monoculture (a single species crop) and it's associated chemicals ensuring that. It has become so critical that we are now genetically modifying our food in an attempt to increase yields and make our food more chemically friendly. Yip, CHEMICALLY FRIENDLY FOOD, go figure!                                        

                   


The only logical way to ensure our food security is to return small family farmers to the land as these are the people who really care for the soil and who produce good healthy food like our grandparents used to eat.


''What the best and most wisest parent wants for their own child, that, must the community want for all its children.'' - John Dewey.

Early childhood is a critical time. These early, formative years serve as the foundation for all of life's later endeavours. If, as a society, we fail to meet the needs of our young children, it is not just the children who suffer. We, as a society, suffer as well. Their success is our success. Let's not fail them...or ourselves!

Risks & Challenges

 An endeavour of this nature has only one inherent risk and that is the risk of failure. A plus factor to mitigate this risk is that this is the kind of endeavour that only attracts those of the same mindset, not career builders.

I face the biggest risk should the endeavour fail, the risk of losing what I have already contributed. I accept that risk with open arms as the rewards from success far outweigh the surplus I risk to lose.

The Trust's biggest obstacle will be raising enough resources to tackle the enormous task it has undertaken. The magnitude of this task must not be under-rated, millions of people in my home province of Limpopo alone, are affected by hunger and illiteracy. We will engage the services of a professional fundraiser to ensure a steady flow of Corporate funding and sponsorships of learners.


Other Ways You Can Help

We know, from experience, that not all people that want to contribute to this noble project are able to but you CAN contribute something. Your time and your connections.

Please join us on this journey by sharing this campaign and the Facebook page with all and sundry. It is easy, just use the Indiegogo share tools :-)
story_txt:
Our Story.Greetings all good people. My name is Ken Strang, the Founder of The Retsogile Permaculture Education & Training Trust and I'm here to invite you to join me on an incredible journey of giving.Life threw me a curve-ball in the form of failing health and I was put-out-to-pasture. After receiving my pension pay-out and taking a hard look as to ''where to now'' I found myself in the enviable position of having more than I needed for the time I had left. I then realised that, at last, I could be the change I want to see, I could contribute positively, I could give back. There is no doubt in my mind that my generation (baby-boomers and siblings) have been the greatest consumers of all time and that we have a debt to repay, a responsibility to repair the damage we have done.




I am a great believer in the Permaculture way which will not only help alleviate poverty through providing people with the means to feed themselves sustainably but is also a climate change mitigation method in that all the plants extract carbon from the air and fix it back into the soil. People Care! Earth Care! Fair Share!With this goal in mind, I have started a new and exciting
final journey of my life, a rewarding journey that I invite you to join me on.
I have dedicated half my pension monies and half my farm, complete with full
infrastructure, to this cause. I have established a charitable non-profit Trust,
The Retsogile Permaculture Education & Training Trust. A legally
constituted and registered NPO dedicated to improving the lives of the poor
rural folk in South



 Africa. The word Retsogile is a Sepedi (North Sotho) word
meaning ‘’we are standing up’’, ‘’we are getting to work’’. (Pronounced Ret-sue-g-wheelie with the g being gutteral)
The Trust is a collective of like-minded young people who are concerned with the ever increasing level of poverty in South Africa and food security for their families.
Please allow me to introduce the Trustees.
Corle, Shannna, Linah, Cobus and Kyle....and the current teamFront:  Maria, Grace, Rose (1), Magdalene, Queen. (Workers)Back: Andre'. Rose (2). Xola and Anthony. (Volunteers)...and the kiddies...we involve them in everything so they are also team members.OPERATION.The Trust will operate in a dual mode, being a profitable business and an NPO side by side;1. Profitable.  i. Training.  ii. Demonstration Site.  iii. Venue hire.2. NPO.  i. Profits from above.  ii. Donors and sponsorships.
GOALS.

Raising funds through profitable
training programmes and donors and which funds will be used to provide free
education and training to subsistence farmers to assist them in increasing
their yields and varieties sustainably;
To establish food gardens in rural
schools to add value to the School Feeding Scheme (this will have the added
benefit of exposing the students to the ethics of Permaculture and teaching the
students to grow food), and;
To embark on community outreach
programmes in the field of Early Childhood Development by assisting and
training educators and care-givers.

BENEFITS.The benefits to the rural poor
are enormous. Their communal lands are decimated after generations of
unsustainable farming methods. The topsoil is all but gone, but, thankfully,
the lands have never been poisoned by chemicals and therefore can easily be
regenerated.  All that is needed is knowledge, guidance and assistance
which we aim to provide. We will regenerate the land, redesign it on contour
and install water harvesting swales complete with beneficial plants. We will
also establish the foundations of food forests in marginal lands. This will give
the communities the food security they so desperately need. Our starting point
is the Segwashi community and our goal is one communal land per annum.






Just as a
child should not go to bed hungry, so too, a child cannot learn on an empty
stomach. We will establish food gardens in poor rural schools to add value, in
the form of fresh vegetables and fruit, to the current government school
feeding scheme. We will teach the children from a young age the importance of
healthy food and how to grow it and the need to respect and care for the Earth
and all its life forms. This will help to develop a generation that will change
the way we treat the Earth and each other, a caring generation. Our starting
point is Glenshiel Primary School, where we have already started, and Segwashi Primary School and our goal is
one school food garden every six months.




Many elderly
folk are caring for their children’s children on their meagre pensions and
therefore most of these children do not have any pre-school guidance and
tuition. We aim to change this by establishing pre-school centres and assisting
and training educators and care-givers in Early Childhood Development. This
will have the benefit of the timely development of motor skills and other
important aspects of their development as well as identify any shortfalls early
in their development so that these can be concentrated on. Our starting point
is the Segwashi community and our goal is one pre-school per annum.


ACHIEVE GOAL 1.
How do we plan to achieve our first goal?

We will provide free training to subsistence
farmers and equip them with the necessary knowledge and skills required to farm
sustainably.
We will provide financial and practical
assistance to subsistence farmers to repair and regenerate their lands and to
implement a relevant Permaculture design to their lands to ensure the
sustainability of said lands. This will require installing water-harvesting
swales (ditches or depressions) on contour every 20 meters and planting the
berms with beneficial plants such as nitrogen fixers and dynamic accumulators.
Our starting point is the Segwashi community and
our goal is one communal land per annum.
ACHIEVE GOAL 2.
How do we plan to achieve our second goal?

We will conduct school tours on the
demonstration site to expose the learners to all aspects of sustainable living
and farming. Here they will witness alternate energy sources such as wind and
solar as well as bio-gas from manure. They will also experience correct and
humane animal husbandry methods, contour farming, mulch application, seed
collection and storage, soil preservation and regeneration techniques,
water-harvesting techniques and much more.
We will establish food gardens in schools
according to the Permaculture methodology and will involve the educators and
learners in these projects from day one ensuring the transfer of the necessary
skills and knowledge at an early stage of the learner’s development.
We will assist in maintaining these gardens by
conducting weekly workshops on site. This will provide us with the opportunity
to impart the necessary knowledge and skills required to rectify any
short-comings and/or reverse any problems, such as diseases, that may occur.
Our starting point is the Glenshiel (already started) and Segwashi
Primary Schools and our goal is one school garden every six months.


ACHIEVE GOAL 3.
How do we plan to achieve our third goal?

We will provide assistance to teachers through a
qualified Early Childhood Development educator to help improve their teaching
methods, if so needed, after observation of lessons given by the teachers. The
ECD educator will also advise of any new or improved techniques that may be
developed.
We aim to establish proper pre-school centres
equipped with the necessary tools required to provide toddlers with a proper
education in their critical formative years. To ensure this we will train
pre-school teachers and care-givers on site and seek bursaries and/or sponsorships
for those that are capable and show promise.

Our starting point is the Segwashi community and
our goal is one pre-school per annum. Obviously we would like to achieve more but we prefer to set realistic and    achievable goals. progress will depend on funding!

I have already contributed ZAR159 991.00 (USD12 307.00) being;
1. Legal fees for the establishment of the Trust =ZAR32 000 (USD2462.)
2. Permaculture design for farm = ZAR22 300.00 (USD1716.)
3. Teepee for budget accommodation = ZAR14 500.00 (USD1116.)

Further to this, should we be successful in our fundraiser my attorney will deposit a further contribution from me of R100 000 (USD7693), which he is holding in trust for this purpose, into the Trust's bank account.





BUT…
The
Trust is in need of two final projects to complete the first phase of its
development and become fully operational, that of a functional training centre and
student accommodation. We need a boost
to get the project up and running and I invite you to assist in this by contributing

my time and effort is free to the Trust and the results will be my reward.

story:
pronounced "Foll-Enn-Det" 

"Vollendet" is the German word for complete, accomplished.


By joining me on this journey and contributing to my project, you are not only helping me realize a long-lived dream but, above all, you become part of creating a very special wine for you and your friends to enjoy as soon as early 2016.


der Anlass

Making wine is wonderful. Not only is it an opportunity for me to get my hands dirty but I am finally able to create something. It was what I missed most in my various office jobs in Vienna and New York. When I finally pulled the plug on my corporate career and moved to California to make wine, it dawned on me: I can finally MAKE Grüner Veltliner.


die Leidenschaft

Having been born to and raised by American parents in Austria, Grüner Veltliner – besides beer – was the alcoholic beverage of choice at casa de Heinrich.  At 26, I moved to New York City and very much missed the light body, fresh minerality and citrussiness of my beloved Grüner. I researched a number of ways to make this special white wine more widely accessible to the American public but was stopped short at the sheer lack of volume available for export. As Austria’s “national grape”, Grüner Veltliner is not only the most widely planted grape variety in the country but also consumed by its co-nationals leaving very little to share with the rest of the world.


das Abenteuer

It feels like an incredible feat that I was able to come across a grape source here in California, a winery at which to make the wine and hopefully a large group of friends who will help me produce, sell and consume this first vintage of my very own Grüner Veltliner, 2015 VOLLENDET.

Since January, after 13 years of research, exploration and trial and error, I have been working on turning this dream of mine into reality. So far, I have founded AdH Wines, LLC and obtained my ABC Wholesale License. I have been working with an LA-based agency on brand development and label design and have purchased grapes and made the wine. To give you an idea how the proceeds from this crowdfunding campaign will be distributed, please have a look at this chart:


die Entstehung

After the grapes were crushed and pressed in August and fermentation was completed in early September, the wine is now awaiting bottling early next year. This requires final label design and approval, purchasing of bottling and packaging materials and hiring a mobile bottling line. This is where you come in: I need your help in getting the wine in the bottle, on wine store shelves and restaurant menus and into your hands. My goal is to release this first vintage of VOLLENDET in spring of 2016 for my 40th birthday and, more importantly, to enjoy a glass with all of you!


Please help me make it happen, become part of something special! 
Thank you all in advance so very much for your support!

story:
Who are we?

We are Chicago's new independent bookstore. Brought to life by two sisters with a passion for books and serving their community, Volumes Bookcafe aims to bring an even stronger literary haven to this vibrant Wicker Park neighborhood. As former educators, we are eager to open our doors and provide an active literary center that serves all ages. 

What We Need 

We've been working on this store for several years now. We've put our blood, sweat, tears and life savings to get to this point. We are so close to opening we can taste it. Unfortunately, the city of Chicago has thrown us two very big and very expensive curveballs that are holding us up. We need to add a secondary HVAC system to the space as well as upgrade the main water line to the building. While we expected a great number of things with this beautiful 1883 building, we were not anticipating these last two hurdles. 

All of the money collected will go directly towards these two expenses. 

We have the shelves installed. We have our inventory ready to be shipped. Everything is planned, built and accounted for, except for this! 


What You Get

Besides the knowledge that you are helping us to realize our dreams? Well, you will get an assortment of goodies with your donation. Not only will everyone receive their name posted on a donor art installation in the store, but they will also get some goodies!
If you aren't local, that's okay! We can still get you those discounted books via our soon to launch website or over the phone!

The Impact

Your contribution will go directly towards funding the HVAC and Water Line projects. That's it. We have everything else accounted for. Every dime we have already has a home. From thousands of books to cafe equipment and inventory. Yet, this donation will help us to finally open our doors. We aim to provide this community with loads of free programming, kids camps, adult classes, author events, scrabble leagues, book clubs and so much more! 


Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute money, doesn't mean you can't contribute time in the upcoming month. We will be having an unwrapping party for our inventory. We will need volunteers for events in the upcoming months. We would also just really like to meet you, so come on by and see us. Or, just sharing this campaign will make a huge difference. Thank you! 


What Others are Saying About Us

Volumes Book Café will be an amazing addition to the vibrant Wicker Park neighborhood.  The store’s combination of welcoming space and a curated collection of books are going to quickly make it a staple of the community. 
Nancy Rohlen, Ingram Content Group
Having had the opportunity to see firsthand how the space at Volumes will look like before the doors have even opened, it's obvious that Rebecca and Kimberly George are serious about making their mark on the literary landscape of Chicago. In a very big way. Wicker Park, and the rest of Chicagoland, are in for a treat. Rebecca and Kimberly are committed to providing a community space for book and non-book related events, and the bookstore already has a warm and inviting feel to it due to the care and love that Rebecca and Kimberly pour into it every day. Volumes cannot open fast enough, as far as this self-professed booklover is concerned. 
Javier Ramirez, The Book Table

Prize FAQ

Contributors will receive an email with info on how to redeem their perks in the upcoming weeks. 
Discounts can be applied in-store, on our soon-to-be-live webstore, or over the phone! You don't have to be nearby to get the benefit!
For those with t-shirt perks, we will be in contact to get sizes and color preferences.
For the Little Elliot, Big Prize ($275)

 Your contribution will go directly towards funding the HVAC and Water Line projects. That's it. We have everything else accounted for. Every dime we have already has a home. From thousands of books to cafe equipment and inventory. Yet, this donation will help us to finally open our doors. We aim to provide this community with loads of free programming, kids camps, adult classes, author events, scrabble leagues, book clubs and so much more! 
 
    Other Ways You Can Help Just because you can't contribute money, doesn't mean you can't contribute time in the upcoming month. We will be having an unwrapping party for our inventory. We will need volunteers for events in the upcoming months. We would also just really like to meet you, so come on by and see us. Or, just sharing this campaign will make a huge difference. Thank you! 

What Others are Saying About Us
Volumes
 Book Café will be an amazing addition to the vibrant Wicker Park 
neighborhood.  The store’s combination of welcoming space and a curated 
collection of books are going to quickly make it a staple of the 
community. 
Nancy Rohlen, Ingram Content GroupHaving had the opportunity to see firsthand how the space at Volumes 
will look like before the doors have even opened, it's obvious that 
Rebecca and Kimberly George are serious about making their mark on the 
literary landscape of Chicago. In a very big way. Wicker Park, and the 
rest of Chicagoland, are in for a treat. Rebecca and Kimberly are 
committed to providing a community space for book and non-book related 
events, and the bookstore already has a warm and inviting feel to it due
 to the care and love that Rebecca and Kimberly pour into it every day. 
Volumes cannot open fast enough, as far as this self-professed booklover
 is concerned. Javier Ramirez, The Book Table
Prize FAQ
Contributors will receive an email with info on how to redeem their perks in the upcoming weeks. 
Discounts can be applied in-store, on our soon-to-be-live webstore, or over the phone! You don't have to be nearby to get the benefit!
For those with t-shirt perks, we will be in contact to get sizes and color preferences.
For the Little Elliot, Big Prize ($275)

story:
For over 15 years 2 brothers from Minneapolis, Brian and Alan Krohnke, have brought you some of the finest artisan coffee. And now they bring you a unique, economically sustainable, new coffee grown and produced in the beautiful cloud forest of Tandayapa. 


                         

                      Brian and Alan Krohnke Cupping coffee in Minneapolis MN


                         

                   Coffee Tree Seedling                                Mature Coffee Cherries



                                   

Nested in the beautiful Tambo Quinde Nature Reserve our coffee farm practices sustainable farming that is also environmentally friendly. Our first crop of coffee was harvested in late 2015 and has landed in Minneapolis, ready to share with you.

                                          You can learn more about our farm here:

                                          http://www.cloudforestcoffeefarms.com


                        

                                                      

Bright, fruity and flavorful our Arabica bean coffee is one of a kind.  Grown at 6,000 feet elevation, our coffee is uniquely aromatic and has a distinctive flavor that comes from maturing in its ideal shade environment. Small batch roasted in Minneapolis MN our coffee is also carbon negative, artisan, and environmentally sustainable.

                                      

                                             Coffee cherries and stinging IO caterpillar, pickers beware!

                      

                                           

Tiny Footprint Coffee resulted from a collaboration between Brian’s Mindo Cloudforest Foundation experience and Alan’s years as a specialty coffee buyer, roaster and distributor in Minneapolis. 

Alan Krohnke- Established Tiny Footprint Coffee in 2010 as the first craft roast carbon negative coffee .  

Brian Krohnke- A dual US and Ecuadorian citizen has been working for 20 years preserving cloud forests in his adoptive home as a founder and director of Mindo Cloud Forest Foundation

Juan Manuel Carrión- A leader in Ecuadorian Ornithology and conservation dating back several decades. For the past several years he has been the director of Quito's Zoo.


                                              

Your contribution will help fund a bilingual, educational trail through the Tambo Quinde shade coffee plantation, ending at a rustic, eco-coffee bar where visitors can sample the crop. The trail will guide visitors through every stage of coffee production from seed to shrub to roasted bean. If you come during harvest, you can do a symbolic picking, de-pulping, and washing. We value your contribution and want you to be able to see how it´s done first hand.



This new tourism offer will be built into our working shade coffee plantation helping it achieve sustainability. This includes:

• Giving tourists a hands on experience

• Expanding our coffee venture

• Funding sustainable ecotourism 

• Reforesting degraded cattle pastures -- Our plantations are in-sum, new agroforestry units on what was once slash and burned land.


                                               Road to our farm in Ecuador

                       

Coffee, like most all commodities, is difficult in that the market experiences wild price swings and it takes four to five years to bring to full production. Some of our lots are just beginning to produce, so this now addition will help us stay afloat and keep investing as we wait for the rest of the coffee to catch up.

                                          A solar drying bed being constructed 


                                

                                 

Your financial help is important to us, but so is your involvement. We want you to be able to enjoy the full extent of the coffee experience. That´s why we have rewards for you, here’s what they look like:



By donating to our cause you won´t only be helping us you'll also be helping:

•Reduce your carbon footprint

•Help create rural jobs in megadiverse Ecuador

•Plant trees that will help restore the cloud forest

Your financial help is important to us, but so is your involvement. We want you to be able to enjoy the full extent of the coffee experience. That´s why we have rewards for you, here’s what they look like:

story:
Green Electricity For Everyone.


Our Vision and Aim for this Project.

Our vision is to provide each and every user of electricity with the best possible chance of finding a green energy with zero emissions and no environmental impact that can influence our life on earth dramatically. Help us to make it happen.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

About the Project.

To build a self-powered Power Station using contact electrification and water as components to generate a continuous electrical charging current to meet your electricity supply needs.

Earth Ambient Temperature Resistant Electricity (ATRE)

This is about the use of simple contact electrification and water component technology in building self-powered power stations with zero emissions and no environmental impact.

Earth Ambient Temperature Resistant Electricity (ATRE) technology will replace electric generation using sun or wind with water forever, provided water is present in the main plasma tank of the power station.

The Problem We Hope To Solve

ATRE project is aimed at helping in the fight against climate change because it produces energy with zero emissions and no environmental impact. This project will help in making sure everyone or organizations that need electricity get it readily available at a low cost with little maintenance. ATRE envisions providing home dwellers, cities,  rural communities and isolated areas  and industries with electricity. Imagine meeting your electricity needs with an ATRE power station, then you will have no need for a national electricity grid.

What We Have Done So Far

During the past 3 years the inventor has done research and experimental work on ATRE circuitry design and the development of the basic operating principles to generate an electrical current using very opposing metals to contact one another to form an Earth Ambient Temperature Resistant Battery Cell.

The battery cell created is a very simple galvanic cell separated by graphite-magnesium crystals.  The crystals are placed under opposing force conditions with the help of an electro-magnetic array of conductors and a special designed magnetic non conductive water plug.  The Oxygen component in water carries electrons that cause a reaction with the water plug that induce a negative charge to the crystal graphite layers, allowing the water oxygen molecules to pass valence electrons to the crystal top surface, creating an electrostatic discharge to the inductors in the magnetic array, creating a voltage and low but constant electrical current.  This reaction appears to be constant as long as the water is in direct contact to the earth through a copper pin and cable that joins to an opposing earth metal antenna.

Six proto-types were built to test various approaches towards the generation of constant electric current using free media such as metals, crystals and water components, Hydrogen and Oxygen. The inventor believes the model as proposed in the promotional video will be the closest solution humans ever achieved, trying to create a form of free electrical current. 

How Much Money We Need

We believe $35000 CAD will be sufficient to complete patent 2 865 299 and register the business, these funds if raised will help us in the filing of additional six patents related to the ATRE Power Station as envisioned in the video.  It is also estimated that sufficient funding will remain at about $12000 to complete the first production tooling for manual assembly (not robotic assembly) of an ATRE Power System Commercial Proto-type.  This proto-type will go on public display.

Why ATRE Technology

-  Compact Design and very scalable technology. It can go very large or very small     to cellphone or laptop size depending on what you want.

-  Easy and inexpensive to manufacture.

-   Low maintenance, user(s) only need to check water levels.

-   Safe, Noiseless and reliable energy generation.

-    Plug & Play Technology Feature. You buy it, you plug it in. That simple.  

(Tell us your location and power frequency and voltage, plus regulations from national grid and you can save on your electricity bill from day one, or use as standalone power station without the grid and save on your bills.)

Challenges Ahead.

We know we are producing a constant electrical current with the invention of this technology for this project.  Risks are in the input power requirements of battery charge controllers that are currently available in the market.  ATRE may require a new approach.  

We anticipate hiring at a later stage the special talents to help us design the perfect controller.

Robotic assembly line is the ultimate goal to make this venture super profitable.  Cost is a challenge, so initially we to rely on manual assembly for the first 10-50 production units before efforts to automate the assembly lines to reduce cost and make the venture super profitable.  Profitable it will be.  

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Thank You!

We feel so grateful to everyone who has taken the time to read our campaign and for those who contributed what they could to make a difference in helping us spread the word, your name will be added to the credits in this new technological advancement ATRE (if you so wish).  Please know your efforts, even the smallest, did not go unnoticed.  We will continue to keep you posted on what your donation helped us achieve.

If all things go well, production units will be shipping in 2017.
Please Help The World Have Easy And Reliable Power Supply Without Bills!

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the link to this campaign with your friends and foe.  You have our sincere THANK YOU!

story:
We are Neeach, the social network for food lovers.

Neeach is the most social, open and direct online community for foodies. We are seeking £30,000 in order to develop and roll out our mobile app to accompany our growing site.

Who are we?

We're a small but dedicated food-loving team at Neeach, working from the UK, Norway and Prague to provide our free foodies' social networking site.

Why a social network for food lovers?

  • The "foodie" is here to stay - more and more of us see food, cooking and eating as a leisure activity.
  • Niche social networks like ours allow foodies to connect, share and discover content and ideas within a community of like-minded people.
  • Our online marketplace also connects food lovers with quality, artisan foods made by small producers all over the world.

Producers, small businesses and bloggers can write about their products on Neeach's free open platform

Why foodies love Neeach

  • We love our friends and family, but we don't always share the same hobbies and interests. Hands up if you ever muted someone's feed because of endless cat gifs? Thought so - we've all done it.
  • Too many photos of your dinner might mean you're the one that gets unfollowed, but fear not - on Neeach, you can post about food and drink as much as you like.
  • If you're a food business, Neeach is a great way to easily reach your target market without having to fight past the clutter of ads and irrelevant, non-targeted content that makes it harder to be seen by your audience.

Find out more about why our users love the Neeach experience in our campaign video.

Users can personalise and customise their feed on Neeach

Foodie social networking on the go

As a social network, we're always looking to build on the great functionality we already have and provide our users with an even better experience. Our mobile app will make it even easier and quicker to connect, share and discover with Neeach wherever they are.

Why a mobile app?

  • Many of our busy members are running businesses, blogs and restaurants and use their mobile devices more than a PC/laptop to manage their online lives.
  • A mobile-specific interface will provide an enhanced user experience through instant, real-time notifications and updates
  • Better connectivity on the go, including instant sharing to other social platforms.

The Money

  • We funded the website ourselves, but we now need to raise £30,000 to develop the first phase of the mobile app with our partners, WDF, test it, roll it out and market it.
  • Our campaign is flexible, so whatever we raise here will be put into developing as much of that app as we can, even if we don't get to the target.

The Perks

We have a great variety of small, medium and bigger perks, including useful tools for your kitchen and of course, the ability to leverage our social networking tools through bespoke content creation and promotion for your business on Neeach.com

Other ways to help

  • Are you a foodie? Join Neeach today and contribute to our community. Share your recipes, connect with others and give us your feedback so we can make our community even better.
  • Spread the word! Use the Indiegogo sharing tools to share our campaign with your contacts on social media and help us make our app a reality.
