story:
What makes New World Ales unique?

Founded in 2015, New World Ales makes traditional American ales of the highest quality. We are much more than your typical microbrewery; we are a group of brewers, artists, and farmers that want to bring small batch artisanal ales back to San Jose and beyond. 

Our unique combination of scientific and practical knowledge allows us to craft exceptional beers using traditional methods, such as gravity brewing and bottle conditioning, and the highest quality ingredients, such as our own estate grown hops. Whether you are a craft beer aficionado or grabbing your first beer off of the shelf, we are confident you will enjoy our hand crafted ales that pay tribute to tradition.

Why should I support New World Ales?

We have been working long and hard to get to where we are today. The initial concept for the brewery was developed over two years ago and we are proud of what we have accomplished so far and the potential ahead of us. Some highlights include:

  • 15 established accounts around the Bay Area currently stock our beer with more added each week.
  • We currently offer four beers in our core line up - Constant Pale Ale, Discovery Amber Ale, Godspeed IPA, and Deliverance Double IPA - with seasonal styles in development.
  • Our beers have been well received by customers and on social media with multiple re-orders in a crowded marketplace.
  • Our experienced and award winning brew master was formally educated at the UC Davis Master Brewer’s Program - one of the premier brewing programs in the country. 
  • The unique nature of our beers is unlike anything else on the market; traditional gravity brewing methods and bottle conditioning is used on all of our bottled products.
  • We are bringing back Bay Area brewing tradition by crafting beers with truly local ingredients, including hops from the New World Ales Hop Ranch - the largest in the Bay Area.
  • The traditional and natural production of our beers goes hand in hand with the movement towards more sustainably produced, local, and environmentally friendly goods.
  • We completely recycle wastes produced during brewing and pruning of the hop ranch as feed for farm animals.
  • Our branding is finalized with future expansion in mind, and current intellectual property is protected by trademarks.

But we need your help to build our own brewery. Our beers are currently contract brewed, and while that has helped us to get our foot in the door, we need to have a custom built brewing system in order to keep brewing beer in larger quantities while maintaining our traditional methods; our processes are just that unique. We want to ensure that we can get you a traditionally brewed beer whenever and wherever you want it. Even if you don't live in California, please support us as the more we raise, the more likely we will be able to distribute outside of the state and even outside of the country.

What specific improvements can I help bring to New World Ales with my support?

With your support, we can make more beer, bottle it faster, get it to you sooner, and offer you an experience unlike any other.

$150,000 - Custom built brewery. In order to keep up with our traditional methods, we plan on using Johnson Brewing Design out of England to create a truly traditional gravity fed brewing system from the birthplace of ales. Made according to our specifications, this one of a kind system will produce one of a kind ales.

$100,000 - Creation of the physical building to house our brewery and development of the surrounding premises. We want you to come to our brewery. At the hop yard. Tentative plans will be to have our brewery located directly next to our hop yard so that you can enjoy a pint while taking a stroll through the towering hop bines. All operations will be as green as possible, including the use of the animals on the farm to "recycle" our spent grains and wastes.

$75,000 - Professional bottling line. A more streamlined bottling line will get beers in your hands faster. Our beers will still all be bottle conditioned, but improved bottling means getting you fresher beer and sending it beyond the Bay Area.

$25,000 - Supply of silkscreened bottles. While silkscreened bottles are more expensive, they sure do look good. Help us make our bottles look as good as the beer inside.

$10,000 - Trademarking of additional beer names. Help us protect our identity so that we can continue to bring you unique beers with unique names. Protection of intellectual property is becoming increasingly important with the unprecedented growth of craft brewers. We have our name, main logo, and core beer names trademarked but have several more names and logos we would like to trademark and protect.


Tell me more about your core line up of beers. Where can I find them?

Named after ships that brought settlers to the New World, these beers will help guide your venture into the New World of craft beer. In addition to these four core beers, we plan on offering four seasonal beers as well, with a Wet Hopped IPA and Imperial Stout planned for the fall and winter of this year.

Currently, our beers are being sold at 15 locations throughout the South Bay Area and Peninsula of California with more added each week. Check the "Find Beer" tab on our website - newworldales.com - to find out exactly where. Once we are able to increase production, we will be able to expand to new markets. If you want New World Ales near you, let us know, and we will get our beers there!

Tell me more about these traditional methods of gravity brewing and bottle conditioning.

Our traditional methods of gravity brewing - using gravity to move raw materials and beer throughout the brewery - and bottle conditioning - naturally carbonating the beer through a secondary fermentation in the bottle - have been used for hundreds, if not thousands, of years. This distinguishes our beer as "real ale" and makes us a rarity in the marketplace.

Modern innovations, such as automation, filtration, and pasteurization, have streamlined the brewing process and led to the abandonment of traditional methods. We are bringing them back - albeit with a modern understanding of science to assure a consistently premium product.


Why should I drink New World Ales beers?

Besides being traditionally brewed, our beers are made with the finest all natural ingredients. We use only the highest quality malted barley and hops as a base for our beers and accent them with additions of rye, wheat, oats, honey, and sugar depending on the style of beer being brewed. All of our beer is produced in small hand crafted batches, meaning you can always be assured you are getting a fresh bottle of beer when you want one.

They are also meant to be a pleasant compliment to a meal or a refreshing way to end a long day, not a challenge to your taste buds. In a time when very high strength beers, heavily hopped beers, sour beers, and even bizarre beers made with insects and animal parts (trust me, you don't want to know) are starting to become commonplace, we know you will find our beers to be quite quaffable.


What about your estate grown hops?

In addition to using traditional methods, we are bringing back some of the Bay Area's brewing history with our half acre hop ranch in San Martin, California. In the late 1800s, some of the best hops in the nation were grown in San Jose, and we believe our hops are just as good. Over 250 plant sites cover the yard and include twelve different varieties of hops: Cascade, Centennial, Chinook, Cluster, Columbus, Crystal, Horizon, Magnum, Newport, Nugget, Sorachi Ace, and Willamette.

While we will be brewing our own wet hop beers with the most premium hops grown, we will also be partnering with local breweries around the Bay Area to supply them with fresh, wet hops during this year's harvest. Fresh, wet hopped beers have intensely fresh fruit, floral, and pine hop character that is complemented by an underlying earthy and resinous flavor unique to fresh, wet hopped beers.


Why San Jose?

Besides the rich brewing history San Jose has to offer, we want to be able to expose these traditional brewed beers to as many people as possible and what better place to do it than in the hub of modern technology. Our beers will hopefully serve as a reminder to all those who live, work, and travel to San Jose that we shouldn't completely abandon tradition for technology; we should, instead, be proud to honor our past.

The mastermind behind New World Ales, Mark Denari, was also born and raised in San Jose. He has been brewing award winning beers for over seven years and graduated from the UC Davis Master Brewers Program in the summer of 2014. During his time there, he realized the science of brewing suggested that using traditional brewing methods in place of more convenient modern alternatives created a superior product. Inspired to pay tribute to these traditional methods, Mark set out to create what New World Ales has become today, and he is excited to share a bit of history with you through our premium, artisan American ales.


Risks and challenges

With craft breweries opening at an unprecedented rate, the need to stand out and be different will become much more important. We believe our unique story does just that but may present us with the challenge of keeping up with demand in the future. 

Producing small batch beers means there aren't many out there in the market, but we are confident in our current system being able to produce enough beer for those who want it. If necessary, however, we can meet these demands through contract brewing arrangements with larger breweries. 

We will do our best to brew as traditionally as possible on their systems, but some tweaks to the process may have to be made. Of course, a really easy way to solve this potential issue is to help us raise well over our goal so we can get started on our own brewery as soon as possible!

Thank you for your support, and we look forward to getting you traditionally brewed beers soon. Be sure to check out newworldales.com for more information about the brewery and hop ranch!
story_txt:
What makes New World Ales unique?Founded in 2015, New World Ales makes traditional American ales of the highest quality. We are much more than your typical microbrewery; we are a group of brewers, artists, and farmers that want to bring small batch artisanal ales back to San Jose and beyond. Our unique combination of scientific and practical knowledge allows us to craft exceptional beers using traditional methods, such as gravity brewing and bottle conditioning, and the highest quality ingredients, such as our own estate grown hops. Whether you are a craft beer aficionado or grabbing your first beer off of the shelf, we are confident you will enjoy our hand crafted ales that pay tribute to tradition.Why should I support New World Ales?We have been working long and hard to get to where we are today. The initial concept for the brewery was developed over two years ago and we are proud of what we have accomplished so far and the potential ahead of us. Some highlights include:
15 established accounts around the Bay Area currently stock our beer with more added each week.
We currently offer four beers in our core line up - Constant Pale Ale, Discovery Amber Ale, Godspeed IPA, and Deliverance Double IPA - with seasonal styles in development.
Our beers have been well received by customers and on social media with multiple re-orders in a crowded marketplace.
Our experienced and award winning brew master was formally educated at the UC Davis Master Brewer’s Program - one of the premier brewing programs in the country. 
The unique nature of our beers is unlike anything else on the market; traditional gravity brewing methods and bottle conditioning is used on all of our bottled products.
We are bringing back Bay Area brewing tradition by crafting beers with truly local ingredients, including hops from the New World Ales Hop Ranch - the largest in the Bay Area.
The traditional and natural production of our beers goes hand in hand with the movement towards more sustainably produced, local, and environmentally friendly goods.
We completely recycle wastes produced during brewing and pruning of the hop ranch as feed for farm animals.
Our branding is finalized with future expansion in mind, and current intellectual property is protected by trademarks.
But we need your help to build our own brewery. Our beers are currently contract brewed, and while that has helped us to get our foot in the door, we need to have a custom built brewing system in order to keep brewing beer in larger quantities while maintaining our traditional methods; our processes are just that unique. We want to ensure that we can get you a traditionally brewed beer whenever and wherever you want it. Even if you don't live in California, please support us as the more we raise, the more likely we will be able to distribute outside of the state and even outside of the country.What specific improvements can I help bring to New World Ales with my support?With your support, we can make more beer, bottle it faster, get it to you sooner, and offer you an experience unlike any other.$150,000 - Custom built brewery. In order to keep up with our traditional methods, we plan on using Johnson Brewing Design out of England to create a truly traditional gravity fed brewing system from the birthplace of ales. Made according to our specifications, this one of a kind system will produce one of a kind ales.$100,000 - Creation of the physical building to house our brewery and development of the surrounding premises. We want you to come to our brewery. At the hop yard. Tentative plans will be to have our brewery located directly next to our hop yard so that you can enjoy a pint while taking a stroll through the towering hop bines. All operations will be as green as possible, including the use of the animals on the farm to "recycle" our spent grains and wastes.$75,000 - Professional bottling line. A more streamlined bottling line will get beers in your hands faster. Our beers will still all be bottle conditioned, but improved bottling means getting you fresher beer and sending it beyond the Bay Area.$25,000 - Supply of silkscreened bottles. While silkscreened bottles are more expensive, they sure do look good. Help us make our bottles look as good as the beer inside.$10,000 - Trademarking of additional beer names. Help us protect our identity so that we can continue to bring you unique beers with unique names. Protection of intellectual property is becoming increasingly important with the unprecedented growth of craft brewers. We have our name, main logo, and core beer names trademarked but have several more names and logos we would like to trademark and protect.Tell me more about your core line up of beers. Where can I find them?Named after ships that brought settlers to the New World, these beers will help guide your venture into the New World of craft beer. In addition to these four core beers, we plan on offering four seasonal beers as well, with a Wet Hopped IPA and Imperial Stout planned for the fall and winter of this year.Currently, our beers are being sold at 15 locations throughout the South Bay Area and Peninsula of California with more added each week. Check the "Find Beer" tab on our website - newworldales.com - to find out exactly where. Once we are able to increase production, we will be able to expand to new markets. If you want New World Ales near you, let us know, and we will get our beers there!Tell me more about these traditional methods of gravity brewing and bottle conditioning.Our traditional methods of gravity brewing - using gravity to move raw materials and beer throughout the brewery - and bottle conditioning - naturally carbonating the beer through a secondary fermentation in the bottle - have been used for hundreds, if not thousands, of years. story:
Small Community, Big Dreams

Building a sustainable future for communities in Afghanistan

Emerging from the Taliban governance 14 years ago, the Bamyan area has faced many challenges in fighting poverty.  Only a small proportion of the land is cultivatable, the rangelands have been degraded from overgrazing, and the efficiency of the farming remains low.

Beekeeping has been identified as one of the most promising microenterprises to eliminate poverty and empower women in Afghanistan’s Bamyan area.  It provides cash income and contributes to food security, as well as providing opportunities for female economic independence in a socially acceptable way.

BEES is a micro-enterprise seeking to promote beekeeping in the Bamyan area.  The project has the potential to transform the lives of communities, and especially the women of the area.  We need you to help us on the way to building peace, prosperity and sustainability.

Who We Are

We are a cooperative, built from the communities of the Bamyan area, seeking to educate and empower ourselves.  We are a female focused organisation, that aims to provide independent livelihoods for women that otherwise have very few opportunities.  Our organisation consists of 9 female trained bee-keepers, 22 female board members, and 225 female beekeepers.

What We Do

In a nutshell: education, equipment and coordination

Achieving ‘critical mass’ for such micro-industries  requires the participants at all levels to work more closely with each other, share information and pool resources towards achievement of collectively understood goals with strategies that are aligned.  Problems such as swarming and disease can be debilitating for individual beekeepers: the cooperative seeks to minimise damage by providing assistance.  We also seek to consolidate links with beekeepers and their markets, developing a collaborative Business Plan, packaging and branding

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $9000 to fund the purchase of:

  • a second-hand Toyota townace model 1993 ($6500); and
  • essential beekeeping equipments such as smoke pump, metal hive tool, Honey extractor machine, etc. The detailed items are outlined below:
Hats Beekeeping clothing (like doctor cloth) Packaging glass jars (450 gram)
Brush Wax 1kg plastic jars
Smoke pump Queen Excluder 250g plastic jars
Gloves Frame feeder 300g plastic jar
Scratcher Apivar (mite medicine) Bee hive with colony
Metal hive tool  Formic Acid (mite medicine) Honey Super
Beekeeping clothing (like rain coat) Honey extractor machine Empty hive

The Impact

The project has a successful track record, and major project achievements include:

·  Establishment of 148 apiaries with 273 bee hives across two districts, 25 cooperatives, and 40 villages

·  Development of a locally appropriate beekeeping training curriculum including a series of seasonal follow up trainings and outputs which benefited 19 trained trainers and over 250 uneducated women

·  Production of 1,182Kg of pure honey in the first Summer season, so far 75% of the honey has been sold for an average price of US$16.5 within communities and US$18.5 when sold by the Bamyan Beekeeping Cooperative

However, the BBES is still in its infancy, and we need to enhance our capacity and knowledge to grow and develop.  Your contributions are essential for our business in two ways:

  • The development of equipment and technology solutions increase output and efficiency.  There are currently200 beekeepers with 273 hives producing 3.65 kg of honey per year.  We aim to increase these figures, with 300 hives producing 7.5 kg of honey per year by programme end.
  • Transport costs make up ~70% of the cooperative’s estimated operational costs. Beekeepers reside in 40 different locations across the districts and sometimes in very remote areas.  The purchase of a vehicle would be invaluable to the project, allowing the efficient transfer of knowledge and equipment across the province.

story:
About Us

Hello there, my name is Saravanan Gopalraj. We are planning to setup a laundry business in Bangalore City (Startup hub of India). QuikWash will bring the change and innovate the commercial laundry landscape in Bangalore city of  India.

QuikWash offer a quick, reliable, hygienic and affordable laundry solution. Need your support for setting up this business.  

We want to make QuikWash the fastest and most affordable way to get your laundry and dry cleaning done in Bangalore.


What's Unique in QuikWash ?



Our Team


What We Need ?


We are initially raising 5000 US $ for this venture.



Forecasting Revenue and Profit:

Bangalore – Silicon Valley of India

It has a population of about 8.42 million and a metropolitan population of about 8.52 million, making it the third most populous city and fifth most populous urban agglomeration in India.

Our venture will be laid up in the centre of the City to cover more areas and provide better and fast service for all.

Sample Space - Six months

Total Revenue –  8,76,000 INR (14,600 USD)

Total Expense  -  6,48,000 INR (10,800 USD)

Total Profit  -  2,28,000 INR (3800 USD)

Profit Cut for Funders:

2% of 3800 USD = 76 USD (Bi-Annually) 

4% of 3800 USD = 152 USD (Bi-Annually)

For Others: 
We will able to provide employment for 10 - 15 people.

& What You Get


  • 1$ USD

You're In!

You will forever be remembered as a contributor in my heart.


  • $5 USD

High Five

You get a virtual high-five from me. If I see you in person, you get it for realz!


  • $10 USD

Shout Out

I will create a video, thanking you all by name. (Unless you specify your anonymity)


  • $100USD

Shirt-Earner

I will send you a T-shirt with the "QuikWash" logo.


  • $250USD

This Is Sparta!

You get a "QuikWash" and "Whirl  Logo" T-shirt AND your name will forever remain on the site's page, thanking you all.


  • $500USD

Nothing can match it!!!

I will send you a T-shirt with the "QuikWash" n "Whirl" Logo tshirt for your entire family. Pack of 6 T-shirts


  • $1,000USD

You made it for us and we will make a big share for you!!!

I will send you a T-shirt with the "QuikWash" n "Whirl" Logo tshirt for your Friends n Family. Pack of 20 T-shirts



Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you are unable to contribute, we understand that. But you can always share it to all your friends. Get the word out about the campaign and the video. By sharing it, you are also supporting us. 


For further queries and information,

Please mail us: 

quikwashcare@gmail.com

saravanangopalraj02@gmail.com

bharaniroja01@gmail.com


Skype: quikwash



Thanks in advance for all your support!!!

Make it happen for QuikWash and the team.

story:
It started with a conversation about how hard it is for small business to compete with big corporate companies. What if there was a small business that helped other small businesses? Hmm.. Thats where the idea for the COLLAB BOX came from. A box filled with things that you never even knew you loved. Delivered straight to your door, once, twice, or every month of the year from small businesses/ artisans around the world. Now you have the chance to try things that you didn't know existed, or maybe you have been buying elsewhere all this time. Our goal is to put money back into communities. This is your chance to support small business and their owners who do what they do because they love it.

What we are asking for, in the grand scheme of things is not a ton. It is just enough to get the first boxes going. We are lucky enough to have some great small businesses already backing our boxes. They have donated products and items to be put into these boxes and we are so excited for you to try them! The funds we raise here are going to packaging and shipping needs (boxes, tape, postage, etc) as well as the ability to now be able to purchase from these small businesses as well as others, to make our boxes even better than they are now! 

There are always risks when trying to start a business. The possibility of failure is a scary one. However, it is not one we at COLLAB LA are willing to accept. We are excited, the people already collaborating with us are excited, and we hope this excitement rubs off on you! 

Just because you can't contribute, doesn't mean you can't help! Word of mouth, and social media are a great way to get a buzz going. So if you like what you've read,  tell a friend! And maybe go check out our website, Instagram @COLLABLOSANGELES, Twitter @COLLAB_LA, and Facebook.

Thank you so much for taking the time to check this out! It is much appreciated

story:
I am the United Way Coordinator for Cub Foods Har Mar Mall. Each year I think of new ways to raise money for the Twin Cities United Way. This year is no different.

In Aug 13, I will be running the field in the Mascot Race at Target Field as the Minnesota Twins take on the Texas Rangers. My goal is to be one of the five mascots running the field. I could be Louie the loon, Wanda the walleye, Babe the blue ox, Skeeta the mosquito and Bullseye the dog.

Hopefully, I can run fast in one of those costumes.

story:
REAL FRUIT. REAL CANDY. Natural Vitamin Candy.

Unlike the typical gummy candies in the market, Queenbees are made with 100% REAL FRUIT which allows the body to absorb the vital nutrients of the fruit. Our system adapts extensive quality control to acquire only the finest and freshest fruits in Luzon, Visayas, Mindanao and the whole Asia. Our innovative design allowed us to make our own candy flavorings. These are NOT FRUIT EXTRACTS but the purest form of fruit blended in our candies.

ORGANIC EXTRA VIRGIN COCONUT OIL.

One of our pioneering products is the crystal clear Extra Virgin Coconut Oil (EVCO), the world's first EVCO gummy candies. Extra Virgin Coconut Oil is globally recognized for its diverse health benefits ranging from treating infections, obesity to heart diseases. The unique advantage of developing these marvelous candies is that they are enjoyable yet practical, without comprising the health benefits. Candy yet Healthy.

Explosive flavors are also coming your way: Tropical Lemon (good for sore throat), jackfruit and other tropical fruits.


EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR DISABLED.

In developing countries such as Philippines, disabled people are still struggling to access basic human rights and liberties. One such right is employment which is often out of reach to disabled people for barriers such as environmental (building), institutional (lack of funding to sustain services), social (discrimination) and physical. We want to break these barriers by designing effective programs and accessible system for them in our production and plant design.

Help us fund our logistics and accessories, such as packaging materials, to complete our production line.  Your $10 dollar would go a long way. It is not just a monetary value but it gives them HOPE to LIVE, COURAGE to PERSEVERE, and STRENGTH for a better TOMORROW.



THIS IS JUST THE BEGINNING

At full blast operation, we will create more jobs for farmers, men and women, disabled or not. The company will allot at least 30% of employment for the handicapped. Through employment, we helped increased social and community inclusion of the disabled. They are now seen as a contributing member in the family and community.

We plan to make 20 more plants in the different parts of the world with our advocacy in breaking the link between disability, poverty and vulnerability. We are not confined to tropical fruits, whatever is available on local resources, we can process them.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

One major cause of delay in production is the raw materials involved. If Mother Nature will unleash its wrath, our farmers would have limited fruits to harvest. But do not worry, we already have selected few more locations in Southeast Asia for raw materials.

Our system adapts extensive quality control to acquire only the finest and freshest fruits in Luzon, Visayas, Mindanao and the whole Asia. Our innovative design allowed us to make our own candy flavorings. These are NOT FRUIT EXTRACTS but the purest form of fruit blended in our candies.ORGANIC EXTRA VIRGIN COCONUT OIL.One of our pioneering products is the crystal clear Extra Virgin Coconut Oil (EVCO), the world's first EVCO gummy candies. story:
The Business I started about a month ago is called Minton TeleCommunications. It's easily found online.

I broke my back at 21, and have spent much time on Disability. However, I saw a way out, and I seized it. Unfortunately, with the capital I started with (a $2,500.00 loan), I way low-balled myself. I had no idea the expense it would take to really do it right.

What We Need & What You Get

I've figured that I need around $5,000.00 more to make this work:

  • I wasn't planning on my laptop being on the verge of blowing up. Time-and-again, it has suffered from a "thermal shutdown," and I don't think it has long to go. I also need to buy special platforms to organize the business leads I willl have to purchase. Add to that advertising, phone bills, well, you get the idea.
  • What my business is has turned out to be a business to business telemarketing company. I know, "telemarketing, YUCK!" But remember, the vast majority of my business will not involve consumers, but rather businesses.
  • If my entire goal is not reached, I will still put the money into the business and make the best I can with what I have.

The Impact

The impact of your generosity in this campaign is almost inexplicable. I'm not trying to buy a new car or a bigger house. I've (honestly) had 9 back surgeries, and this is something I can do at home, taking breaks when I need to.

  • This venture also makes a positive change for the  community, and really the country. If successful, there will be one less person on the disability rolls, 2 less kids needing public assistance. It really is a win-win.
  • I have 15 plus years in the telemarketing and business fields. I have many good ideas, and although I had to drop for medical reasons, I'm educated enough to have been a Junior at Indiana Wesleyan University.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • As I've mentioned, I have many years in the field in which I will be going into business. I know there will be challenges. There are certain times of the year (mainly the holidays and tax time) when businesses become very difficult to convince to buy a product, or even talk about it.
  • However, I majored in Human Services at IWU, so I have some experience in the psychology of people. Also, I have a PhD in Hard Knocks, so I know when to "store my nuts" for the winter. I WILL NOT fail, if given the opportunity.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you personally unable to contribute, or invest as I see it, please tell your friends about this situation and pass along how they could help. That would be of great assistance! Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
If you don't know, now you know!

Hello, and thank you so much for stopping by and taking the time to check out our campaign!

I am Suzy Phillips, owner/operator of Gypsy Queen Cuisine Food truck, based out of beautiful Asheville, North Carolina.  After 4 years in business as a food truck, we are taking the leap into a brick and mortar

(Yayyyyyyyyy!  Hip, hip, Hoooorayyyyyy!!!!!)

This means, consistency, dependability, rain or shine, winter or summer, we will be here in one spot to feed your need, and love, for our delicious Lebanese food!

In addition, we landed an account with Whole Foods to sell our line of dips, salads, sauces, soups, falafels and more! 

We are up-fitting our new space to a full commercial kitchen to increase production for better distribution, we are making it pretty and bringing it to life, and oh so comfortable for you, your family and friends.

This is a long time dream coming true!  With your help and contribution, we can make sure we are covering all our bases that our small business loan can't, and you'll be supporting a business that has tastiness and sustainability high on it's list of priorities! 

Make a difference

  • We are raising $25,000 for kitchen equipment, interior design, catering van, labels for our retail items, bottles for our sauces, biodegradable containers for our dips, furniture for our Deli, VCM ( a 40 quart heavy duty, industrial food processor, to make our falafel and dips in large quantities for Whole Foods and our deli).
  • We have built our business from scratch, with no outside investment, and we’re really proud that we have grown organically without sacrificing the quality of our food, service, or principles. We are hoping that Indiegogo will be a great way to raise the extra funds we need to finish out this terrific space we finally got to bring to the public and to our clients, who have asked us for years “do you have a restaurant ” With your help– the answer can be a resounding “YES!” And we will reward you with some great gifts to say THANK YOU for joining our dream of nourishing you, so you can nourish those around you.

story:
_____________________________________________________________________

There are over 28,000 registered amateur boxers in America. Every day, these young men and women step into boxing gyms while facing tremendous obstacles. In the ring, they have their first experiences with self-control, self-analysis, and ultimately, self-worth.

For almost a half century, the American Association for the Improvement of Boxing has fought to keep boxing a safe, sophisticated, and state-of-the-art sport for the amateur boxer. AAIB Scholarships provide the only financial assistance in the country to high school seniors who want to attend one of the few colleges with boxing programs.

AAIB Scholars are hard-working students and community members as well as disciplined athletes. They receive funding for tuition, textbooks, and other educational needs at an accredited college or university as well as ongoing guidance from the program. The AAIB has presented sixty scholarships since their creation in 1993. Six scholarships were awarded in 2014. Fourteen scholarships were awarded in 2015.

Please donate to the AAIB Scholars today. _____________________________________________________________________

World Heavyweight Champion Rocky Marciano and Hall of Fame coach Steve Acunto founded the AAIB in 1969 to promote boxing in local communities, in the higher education system, through research, and the advancement of national standards, regulations, and legislation. The organization’s biggest impact today is on the lives of students.

The AAIB’s all-volunteer board of directors and staff consists of former boxers, boxing judges, commissioners, announcers, referees, and enthusiasts dedicated to Steve and Rocky’s mission to improve the sport of boxing and support young boxers. One hundred percent of your donation to the AAIB goes directly to its scholars. The growing list of AAIB donors include HBO, Showtime, Chevron, and Dow Chemical.

Please donate to the AAIB Scholars today.
_____________________________________________________________________

AAIB Scholars overcome great odds to compete in the Olympic Trials with USA Boxing and work in fields like medicine, public health, and architecture. National Golden Gloves silver medal winner Donnielle Minor will obtain her MS in Biopharmaceutical Engineering from NJIT next year. NY Golden Gloves silver winner Andre Henry has degrees in chemistry, physics, and an MD and  PhD from UPenn’s School of Medicine. NJ Golden Gloves Champion Barbara Greely at Monmouth University wants to be an agent for the FBI.

The AAIB raised over $25,000 in 2014 for its scholarship fund with its annual golf tournament and fundraiser. We hope to double the amount available to students next year with our first online crowdfunding campaign and also raise awareness with our new web presence at aaib.org. Check out our Indiegogo perks. Follow us on Twitter and Instagram @aaiboxing. Like and share our Facebook Page with friends.

Use our hashtags:  #BoxingScholars  #ImproveBoxing  #BoxingChance

Support the improvement of boxing and help us find more of these determined young individuals. Give each one more than a fighting chance. Give them the discipline, strategy, and confidence of the sweet science and noble art.

Give them the AAIB #BoxingChance. 

Please donate to the AAIB Scholars today.

story:
*Voir plus bas pour la version française

Who we are

The Peace Within Project's mission is to train yoga teachers within underserved communities, in order to bring yoga to populations in need of healing and peace of mind.


Our project

The conflict between Israel and the Palestinian people has affected the region for over 60 years. For generations now, the Palestinian population has been exposed to violence, and as such affected by high levels of psychological stress hampering daily life.

In August 2015 we will provide a free training to 20 women living in the West Bank in the Palestinian Territories to become yoga teachers.

These women will in turn teach yoga in their communities and provide a simple tool to improve the wellbeing of hundreds of people in need of inner peace.

In the last few years a handful of Palestinian women have become yoga teachers and are teaching in their communities. However, the demand is still growing ("people here are hungry for yoga" says one of the local yoga teachers) especially in schools, villages and refugee camps. Our assessment in the West Bank last November confirmed the growing need.

With its well-known benefits on physical and mental health, yoga will rapidly help the Palestinians improve their daily life. Yoga will especially help people cope with the conflict's psychological impact; alleviate stress, anxiety and depression; develop inner peace and enhance their general wellbeing.

                

       Presentation of yoga in a school, Bethlehem, 2014


The impact

By contributing to this project, you will not only enable 20 women to gain a holistic comprehension and practice of yoga, but you will put yoga and inner peace within reach of hundreds of Palestinians in a sustainable manner.

The trainees are coming  from different areas, creating a network of yoga teachers throughout the West Bank – Nablus, Jenin, East Jerusalem, Bethlehem, etc. The trainees selected are school teachers, nurses, midwifes and social workers, serving  the most vulnerable and underserved communities – refugee camps, Bedouin villages, schools, hospitals etc. The project will thus benefit directly the women being trained and indirectly their communities at large.


What we need

Our assessment in the West Bank (Ramallah, Nablus, Bethlehem) in November 2014 determined a total cost for the project of US $11,000. The training is provided pro-bono as none of the participants can afford to contribute financially.  Any amount you can spare will truly help us get closer to our goal.

Budget Breakdown

  • Trainers' (5) international & local transportation - $3,800
  • Space rental (accommodation for trainees & trainers/retreat) - $3,000
  • Food for trainees & trainers - $2,000
  • Interpretation English/Arabic - $1,600
  • Printing & translation of teaching material to Arabic - $300
  • Yoga mat purchase - $300


What you get

You will get to be a part of a groundbreaking community contributing to the spreading of yoga teachings, and helping hundreds of people find happiness and inner peace in a troubled region.


What else can you do

  • Post & share on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram
  • Talk to friends, in person, on the phone
  • Send emails and email lists
  • Think of two friends or businesses who could make a big impact and write them a personal note or give them a call
  • Stay involved. We want you to be part of our community

Getting the word out is what will make of this campaign a success. Thanks a lot, everyone. We can only do it with your help!                                  

                                       


More about the training

Background

The protracted conflict between the Palestinian people and Israel is extremely straining on the Palestinians – military incursions, land confiscations, home destructions, movement restrictions, etc. For generations now, the Palestinian population has been exposed to violence, and as such affected by high levels of psychological stress hampering daily life.

               

               House demolished by the war, Bedouin village, south Hebron, June 2014


Project's details

The course will be specifically tailored for the local needs and the curriculum will include: Yoga philosophy; Meditation; Hatha yoga; Anatomy & physiology; Yoga nidra & yoga for trauma; Pre-natal & post natal yoga; Kids yoga.

30% of the people living in the Palestinian Territories are under the age of 14, therefore, one of our main focuses will be training school teachers in children's yoga. Hundreds of children will have the opportunity to learn a unique empowering tool that will help them to relax, improve focus and concentration; develop self-esteem and confidence. Exposure to yoga will also introduce cornerstone values such as non-violence, gratitude, and self-discipline.

Moreover, Palestinian women have on average 4 children, so training midwives - in particular in prenatal & postnatal yoga - can help to reach out to pregnant women and young mothers at a special time in their lives.

The training will take place in August-September 2015 and will last 16 days including a 10-day intensive retreat and three follow-up weekends (equivalent to a US standard Yoga Teachers Training certification).

The founder and lead trainer has been involved in several teachers trainings, including the first one in a US prison and has worked previously in the region.

The other trainers have been selected based on their experience and specialty (prenatal yoga, etc.)

The training will be free of charge to ensure that women from lower incomes can participate.

           

     Yoga class in Askar refugee camp with teacher Mirna Ali, Nablus, November 2014


Frequently Asked Questions


Why the Palestinian Territories?

We chose the Palestinian Territories as the first location for the Peace Within Project for its specific situation. It is a long-term low intensity conflict; where people are exposed to ongoing violence severely affecting their mental health. What is more, given the economic situation, options are limited in terms of physical activity, wellbeing and psychological support

Pauline, the founder of the Peace Within Project has worked in the Palestinian Territories with Doctors without Borders and Action Against Hunger on mental health programs, witnessing first hand the psychological hardship endured by the Palestinians.

While there is also great need for yoga in the Gaza Strip, given the constraints - access and security situation – we will start in the West Bank and hope to expand into that region as the program progresses.


Does the project have a peace agenda?

The training doesn't fall within a global conflict resolution framework but rather aims at helping the Palestinians to cultivate inner peace. However eventually, if yoga continues growing in the Palestinian Territories, children raised with yoga's peace culture will certainly deal with the conflict in a different manner.


Is Yoga a religion? Does Yoga contradict with Islam?

Yoga is not a religion. Yoga originated in ancient India, where several different religions were and are practiced, but yoga is not directly connected to any religion. A person from any faith can practice yoga, as can an atheist. People with faith often find that a regular practice helps them to strengthen their faith.

Yoga as a spiritual practice does not contradict Islam. Mirna, a Palestinian yoga teacher - Muslim and veiled - indeed sees more similarities than contradictions between yoga and Islam. The daily Muslim prayer entails a meditation-like centering and kneeling bows, echoing yogic poses. The word "ameen" resonates with the word "Om" channeling inner energy and a sense of connection.


Why a course specifically for women?

The Arab/Muslim culture limits the possibility to carry out co-ed physical activity and women have fewer opportunities to practice any form of physical exercise and stay healthy. Furthermore women are particularly affected by the conflict: by extension they risk being exposed to domestic violence (consequence of men's stress, distress and unemployment); they also exhibit a higher prevalence of mental disorders than men. Finally, women are primary relays within the communities as particularly involved in education, health care and social work.

Don't hesitate to ask if you have any other questions!

****************************************************************************

Version Française


Qui sommes nous

La mission du Peace Within Project est de former des professeurs de yoga dans des contextes particulièrement difficiles, mettant le yoga à la portée de populations ayant besoin de paix intérieure.


Pourquoi cette campagne

Le conflit entre Israel et le peuple palestinien affecte la région depuis plus de 60 ans. Depuis des générations maintenant, la population palestinienne est exposée à la violence et affectée par un stress psychologique élevé, impactant la vie quotidienne.

En août 2015 nous allons démarrer une formation de professeurs de yoga gratuite pour des femmes vivant en Cisjordanie dans les Territoires Palestiniens. Une fois formées, ces femmes enseigneront à leur tour le yoga dans leurs communautés et fourniront ainsi un outil simple permettant d'améliorer le bien-être de centaines de personnes ayant un véritable besoin de paix intérieure.


Au cours des dernières années, une poignée de palestiniennes sont devenues professeurs de yoga et enseignent aujourd'hui dans leurs communautés. Cependant la demande continue d'augmenter notamment dans les écoles, les villages et les camps de réfugiés. Notre évaluation sur place en novembre dernier a confirmé le besoin croissant.

Avec ses bienfaits reconnus sur la santé physique et mentale, le yoga peut rapidement aider les Palestiniens à mieux vivre le quotidien. Le yoga peut notamment permettre d'atténuer l'impact psychologique du conflit; d'alléger le stress, l'anxiété et la dépression; de développer la paix intérieure et le bien-être général.


L'impact

En contribuant à ce projet, vous n'allez pas seulement permettre à 20 femmes d'obtenir une large compréhension et pratique du yoga mais vous allez mettre yoga et paix intérieure à la portée de centaines de Palestiniens de manière durable.

Les élèves viendront de différentes régions, formant un réseau à travers la Cisjordanie - Naplouse, Jénine, Jérusalem Est, Béthlehem, etc. et incluront des institutrices, des infirmières, des sages-femmes et des assistantes sociales - atteignant les communautés les plus vulnérables et mal desservies - camps de réfugiés, villages bédouins, etc. Le projet bénéficiera ainsi directement aux femmes recevant la formation et indirectement à leur communauté en général.


Ce dont nous avons besoin

Sur la base de notre évaluation en Cisjordanie (Ramallah, Naplouse, Béthlehem) en novembre 2014 nous estimons qu'ils nous faut $11,000 (€9,750)

Budget détaillé:

  • Transport international & local des formatrices (5) - $3,800
  • Location de l'espace permettant d'accueillir formatrices et élèves - $3,000
  • Nourriture pour les formatrices et les élèves - $2,000
  • Interprétation anglais/arabe - $1,600
  • Impression & traduction du matériel pédagogiques en arabe - $300
  • Achat de tapis de yoga - $300


Ce que vous obtiendrez

Vous ferez partie d'une communauté innovante contribuant à répandre l'enseignement du yoga et aidant des centaines de personnes à trouver bonheur et paix intérieure dans une région en proie aux troubles.


Ce que pouvez vous faire d'autre

  • Postez et partager sur Facebook, Twitter, Instagram
  • Parlez à vos amis, en personne, au téléphone
  • Envoyez des emails individuels et collectifs
  • Pensez à deux amis ou entreprises qui peuvent avoir un impact important et écrivez leur un message personnel ou appelez les
  • Restez impliqué. Nous voulons que vous fassiez partir de notre communauté

Faire passez le mot fera le succès de cette campagne. Un grand merci à tous. Nous ne pouvons pas réaliser ce projet sans vous!


Plus de détails sur la formation


Contexte

Le conflit qui perdure entre Israël et le peuple palestinien est particulièrement difficile pour les Palestiniens - incursions militaires, confiscation de terres, destruction de maisons, restriction de mouvements, etc. Depuis des générations maintenant, la population palestinienne est exposée à la violence et affectée par un stress psychologique élevé, impactant la vie quotidienne.


Détails du projet

Le cours sera spécialement conçu pour répondre aux besoins locaux et le curriculum comprendra: Philosophie du yoga; Méditation; Hatha Yoga; Anatomie et Physiologie; Yoga nidra et Yoga pour le trauma; Yoga pré & post natal; Yoga pour les enfants.

Sachant qu'une personne sur trois a moins de 14 ans dans les Territoires Palestiniens, une de nos priorités sera de former des professeurs en yoga pour les enfants. Des centaines d'enfants auront l'opportunité d'apprendre un outil puissant qui les aidera à se détendre, à améliorer leur concentration et à développer confiance et estime de soi. L'exposition au yoga permettra également d'introduire dès le plus jeune âge des valeurs telles de la non-violence, la gratitude et la discipline.

Aussi, étant donné que les palestiniennes ont en moyenne 4 enfants, former des sages femmes - en particulier au yoga prénatal & postnatal - permettra d'atteindre les femmes enceintes et jeunes mamans à un moment privilégié de leur vie.

La formation aura lieu en août-septembre 2015 et durera 16 jours, incluant une retraite intensive de 10 jours et trois weekends consécutifs.

L'organisatrice a participé dans plusieurs formations de professeurs - notamment la première dans une prison aux Etats-Unis- elle a également déjà travaillé dans la région. Les autres formatrices ont été sélectionnées sur base de leur expérience et spécialité (yoga prénatal, etc.)

La formation sera gratuite pour permettre aux femmes aux revenus inférieurs de participer.


Questions fréquentes


Pourquoi les Territoires Palestiniens?

Nous avons choisi les Territoires Palestiniens comme le premier contexte d'intervention du Peace Within Project pour sa situation singulière. Il s'agit d'un conflit de longue durée et de faible intensité; la population y est continuellement exposée à la violence avec un impact sévère sur la santé mentale. Aussi, au vu de la situation économique les possibilités en terme de sport, bien-être et soutien psychologique sont limités.

Pauline, la fondatrice du Peace Within Project a travaillé dans les Territoires Palestiniens, avec Médecins Sans Frontières et Action Contre la Faim sur des programmes de santé mentale, observant directement les souffrances psychologiques subies par les Palestiniens.

Alors que les besoins de yoga existent également - voir davantage - dans la bande de Gaza, étant donnée les contraintes - accès et situation sécuritaire - nous commençons en Cisjordanie et espérons pouvoir développer ensuite l'activité dans cette zone.


Le projet a t-il un agenda pour la paix?

La formation n'entre pas dans un cadre globale de résolution de conflit mais cherche plutôt à aider les Palestiniens à cultiver la paix intérieure et donc à mieux vivre le conflit. Cependant, si le yoga continue de se développer dans les Territoires Palestiniens, les enfants élevés avec la culture de paix du yoga traiteront certainement le conflit de manière différente.


Le yoga est-il une religion? Le yoga contredit-il l'Islam?

Le yoga n'est pas une religion. Le yoga trouve son origine dans l'Inde ancienne, où de multiples religions étaient et sont aujourd'hui pratiquées, mais le yoga n'est directement connecté à aucune religion. Une personne de n'importe quelle confession peu pratiquer le yoga, de même qu'un athée. Les croyants trouvent souvent qu'une pratique régulière les aide à renforcer leur foi.

Le yoga, pratique spirituelle ne contredit pas l'Islam. Mirna, une professeur de yoga palestinienne - musulmane et voilée - voit d'ailleurs davantage de similarités entre le yoga et l'Islam que de contradictions. La prière quotidienne musulmane inclue une forme de méditation et des prosternations faisant écho aux postures de yoga. Le mot "ameen" résonne avec le mot "Om" canalisant l'énergie intérieure et un sens de connexion.


Pourquoi un cours spécialement pour les femmes?

La culture arabo-musulmane limite les possibilités de mener des activités physiques mixtes et les femmes ont moins d'occasions de faire du sport et de garder la forme. D'autre part, les femmes sont particulièrement affectées par le conflit: elles risquent plus souvent d'être exposées à la violence domestique et présentent une prévalence de troubles psychiques plus élevée que les hommes. Enfin, les femmes sont les relais prioritaires au sein de la communauté: impliquée dans l'éducation, la santé et le travail social. 


N'hésitez pas à nous contacter si vous avez d'autres questions!
story_txt:
*Voir plus bas pour la version française
Who we are 
The Peace Within Project's mission is to
train yoga teachers within underserved communities, in order to bring yoga to populations in need of healing and peace of mind.

Our project

The conflict
between Israel and the Palestinian people has affected the region for over 60
years.
For generations now, the Palestinian population has been exposed to
violence, and as such affected by high levels of psychological stress hampering daily
life.


In August 2015 we will provide a free training to 20 women living in the West Bank in the Palestinian Territories to become yoga teachers.
These women will in turn teach yoga in
their communities and provide a simple tool to improve the wellbeing of hundreds of people in need of
inner peace.

In the
last few years a handful of Palestinian women have become yoga
teachers and are teaching in their communities.
However, the demand is still growing ("people here are hungry for yoga" says one of the local yoga teachers) especially in schools,
villages and refugee camps. Our assessment in the West Bank last November
confirmed the growing need.


With its
well-known benefits on physical and mental health, yoga will rapidly help the Palestinians improve their daily life. Yoga will especially help people cope with
the conflict's psychological impact; alleviate stress, anxiety and depression;
develop inner peace and enhance their general wellbeing.

                
       Presentation of yoga in a school, Bethlehem, 2014



The impact
By contributing to this project, you will
not only enable 20 women to gain a holistic comprehension and practice of yoga, but you will put yoga and inner peace within reach of hundreds of Palestinians
in a sustainable manner.
The trainees are coming  from different areas, creating a network of yoga teachers throughout the West Bank – Nablus, Jenin, East Jerusalem, Bethlehem, etc. The trainees selected are school teachers, nurses, midwifes and social workers, serving  the most vulnerable and underserved communities – refugee camps, Bedouin villages, schools, hospitals etc. The project will thus benefit directly the women being trained and indirectly their communities at large.

What we need 


Our assessment in the West Bank (Ramallah, Nablus, Bethlehem) in November 2014 determined a total cost for the project of US $11,000. The training is provided pro-bono as none of the participants can afford to contribute financially.  Any amount you can spare will truly help us get closer to our goal.  

Budget Breakdown



Trainers' (5) international & local transportation - $3,800
Space rental (accommodation for trainees & trainers/retreat) - $3,000
Food for trainees & trainers - $2,000
Interpretation English/Arabic - $1,600
Printing & translation of teaching material to Arabic - $300
Yoga mat purchase - $300




What you get 
You will get to be a part of a groundbreaking
community contributing to the spreading of yoga teachings, and helping hundreds of people find happiness and inner peace in a troubled
region.

What else can you do


Post & share on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram


Talk to friends, in person, on the phone

Send emails and email lists

Think of two friends or businesses who could make a big impact and write them a personal note or give them a call

Stay involved. We want you to be part of our community

Getting the word out is what will make of this
campaign a success. Thanks a lot, everyone. We can only do it with your help!                                  


                                       


More about the training

Background
The protracted conflict between the Palestinian people and
Israel is extremely straining on the Palestinians – military
incursions, land confiscations, home destructions, movement restrictions, etc.
For generations now, the Palestinian population has been exposed to violence,
and as such affected by high levels of psychological stress hampering daily
life.



               
               House demolished by the war, Bedouin village, south Hebron, June 2014

Project's details
The course will be specifically tailored
for the local needs and the curriculum will include: Yoga philosophy;
Meditation; Hatha yoga; Anatomy & physiology; Yoga nidra & yoga for
trauma; Pre-natal & post natal yoga; Kids yoga.

30% of the people living in the Palestinian Territories are under the age of 14, therefore, one of our main focuses will be training school teachers in children's yoga. Hundreds of children will have the opportunity to learn a unique empowering tool that will help them to relax, improve focus and concentration; develop self-esteem and confidence. Exposure to yoga will also introduce cornerstone values such as non-violence, gratitude, and self-discipline.
Moreover, Palestinian women have on average 4 children, so training midwives - in particular in prenatal & postnatal yoga - can help to reach out to pregnant women and young mothers at a special time in their lives.
The training will take place in
August-September 2015 and will last 16 days including a 10-day intensive
retreat and three follow-up weekends 
(equivalent to a US standard
Yoga Teachers Training certification).

The founder and lead trainer has been involved in several teachers trainings, including the first one in a US prison and has worked previously in the region.
The other trainers have been selected based on their experience and specialty (prenatal yoga, etc.)
The training will be free of charge to ensure that women from lower incomes can participate.

           
     Yoga class in Askar refugee camp with teacher Mirna Ali, Nablus, November 2014


Frequently Asked Questions


Why the Palestinian Territories?
We chose the Palestinian Territories as the
first location for the Peace Within Project for its specific situation. It is a
long-term low intensity conflict; where people are exposed to ongoing violence severely affecting their mental health.
What is more, given the economic situation, options are limited in terms of physical
activity, wellbeing and psychological support
Pauline, the founder of the Peace Within Project
has worked in the Palestinian Territories with Doctors without Borders and Action Against Hunger on mental health
programs, witnessing first hand the psychological hardship endured by the
Palestinians.


While
there is also great need for yoga in the Gaza Strip, given the constraints -
access and security situation – we will start in the West Bank and hope to
expand into that region as the program progresses.






Does the project have a peace agenda?
The training doesn't fall within a global conflict resolution framework but rather aims at helping the Palestinians to cultivate inner peace. However eventually, if yoga continues growing in the Palestinian Territories, children raised with yoga's peace culture will certainly deal with the conflict in a different manner.
Is Yoga a religion? Does Yoga contradict with
Islam?

Yoga is not a religion. Yoga originated in ancient India, where several different religions were and are practiced, but yoga is not directly connected to any religion. A person from any faith can practice yoga, as can an atheist. People with faith often find that a regular practice helps them to strengthen their faith.
Yoga as a spiritual practice does not contradict Islam. Mirna, a Palestinian yoga teacher - Muslim and veiled - indeed sees more similarities than contradictions between yoga and Islam. The daily Muslim prayer entails a meditation-like centering and kneeling bows, echoing yogic poses. The word "ameen" resonates with the word "Om" channeling inner energy and a sense of connection.

Why a course specifically for women?
The Arab/Muslim culture limits the possibility to carry out co-ed physical activity and women have fewer opportunities to practice any form of physical exercise and stay healthy. Furthermore women are
particularly affected by the conflict: by extension they risk being exposed to domestic violence (consequence of men's stress, distress and unemployment); they also exhibit a higher prevalence of
mental disorders than men.
Finally, women are primary relays within the communities as particularly
involved in education, health care and social work.



Don't hesitate to ask if you have any other questions!

****************************************************************************
Version Française


Qui sommes nous
La mission du Peace Within Project est de former des
professeurs de yoga dans des contextes particulièrement difficiles, mettant le
yoga à la portée de populations ayant besoin de paix intérieure.



Pourquoi cette
campagne

Le conflit entre Israel et le peuple palestinien affecte la région depuis plus de 60 ans. Depuis des générations maintenant, la population palestinienne est exposée à la violence et affectée par un stress psychologique élevé, impactant la vie quotidienne.


En août 2015 nous allons démarrer une formation de
professeurs de yoga gratuite pour des femmes vivant en Cisjordanie dans les
Territoires Palestiniens. Une fois formées, ces femmes enseigneront à leur tour
le yoga dans leurs communautés et fourniront ainsi un outil simple permettant
d'améliorer le bien-être de centaines de personnes ayant un
véritable besoin de paix intérieure.

Au cours des dernières années, une poignée de
palestiniennes sont devenues professeurs de yoga et enseignent aujourd'hui dans
leurs communautés. Cependant la demande continue d'augmenter notamment dans les
écoles, les villages et les camps de réfugiés. Notre évaluation sur place en
novembre dernier a confirmé le besoin croissant. 
Avec ses bienfaits reconnus sur la santé physique et
mentale, le yoga peut rapidement aider les Palestiniens à mieux vivre le quotidien.
Le yoga peut notamment permettre d'atténuer l'impact psychologique du conflit; d'alléger
le stress, l'anxiété et la dépression; de développer la paix intérieure et le
bien-être général.

L'impact
En contribuant à ce projet, vous n'allez pas seulement permettre à 20
femmes d'obtenir une large compréhension et pratique du yoga mais vous allez
mettre yoga et paix intérieure à la portée de centaines de Palestiniens de
manière durable.
Les élèves viendront de différentes régions, formant un réseau à travers la
Cisjordanie - Naplouse, Jénine, Jérusalem Est, Béthlehem, etc. et incluront des institutrices, des infirmières, des sages-femmes et des assistantes sociales - atteignant les
communautés les plus vulnérables et mal desservies - camps de réfugiés,
villages bédouins, etc. Le projet bénéficiera ainsi directement aux femmes
recevant la formation et indirectement à leur communauté en général.

Ce dont nous avons
besoin
Sur la base de notre évaluation en Cisjordanie (Ramallah,
Naplouse, Béthlehem) en novembre 2014 nous estimons qu'ils nous faut $11,000
(€9,750)
Budget détaillé:

Transport international & local
     des formatrices (5) - $3,800
Location de l'espace permettant
     d'accueillir formatrices et élèves - $3,000
Nourriture pour les formatrices et
     les élèves - $2,000
Interprétation anglais/arabe - $1,600
Impression & traduction du
     matériel pédagogiques en arabe - $300
Achat de tapis de yoga - $300




Ce que vous
obtiendrez
Vous ferez partie
d'une communauté innovante contribuant à répandre l'enseignement du yoga et
aidant des centaines de personnes à trouver bonheur et paix intérieure dans une
région en proie aux troubles.

Ce que pouvez vous faire d'autre


Postez et partager sur Facebook, Twitter, Instagram

Parlez à vos amis, en personne, au téléphone

Envoyez des emails individuels et
     collectifs

Pensez à deux amis ou entreprises qui peuvent avoir un impact important et écrivez leur un
     message personnel ou appelez les

Restez impliqué. Nous voulons que vous fassiez partir de notre communauté

Faire passez le mot
fera le succès de cette campagne. Un grand merci à tous. Nous ne pouvons pas réaliser
ce projet sans vous!

story:
“If you can’t feed a hundred people, then feed just one.” Mother Teresa

Free Food for All (FFFA) is a strictly non-profit private initiative to feed the less fortunate, regardless of race or religion. 

We chose hunger as our main priority as food is a basic human need. The demanding task of elevating oneself from hardship can then be achieved when their basics needs are satisfied. 

At just SGD$2 a meal, we are optimistic that FFFA can eventually be sustained by contributions from sponsors and members of the public. 

We need … 

SGD$21,000 to feed 350 less-fortunate individuals one meal a day, for 30 days

Each healthy meal consisting of staple (rice), vegetables and meat costs SGD$2

Currently we are short of SGD$15,000

You will be contributing to ...

a project for the community, by the community. No contribution is too small. Ending hunger is no longer a matter of means but rather a matter of will. As a society, we are capable of ensuring that no one has to go hungry again.

Free Food For All had completed other projects with registered charities, gaining local media coverage. This effort for the month of June-July endeavors to continuously feed less-fortunate individuals for a month.

You can help by ...

  • Monetary contributions to feed those in-need
  • Sharing the great news that we are offering free food to those in-need

story:
Who am I?

Hi everyone,

I'm Sean, Uncle Frogface to some. I used to be a performer and teacher. In 2009 I had a serious motorbike accident that changed my life forever. After months of physiotherapy I had almost recovered, however I soon started to decline health-wise. I was getting chronic pain and started to lose the use of both of my legs. I had to stop working when I started using a wheelchair and since then have been trying to get a firm diagnosis. I now have that. as a result of brain injury from the accident I have a condition called FND (functional neurological disorder) which means that even with intense physiotherapy, I'll only ever get back to short spats of walking with a cane.

I haven't let that get me down though. And that's not really what this is about. I remain positive, and I'd like to get back to some sort of work. Now I can't get back to my former work, but I am an artist. I paint, sculpt, design, craft... if its creative, I love it. With your help I could start producing work to sell on a larger scale. I could set myself up as a professional artist rather than a semi-professional. by donating, you are helping an artist to work at his full potential regardless of challenges. I hope one day to work with an arts academy to show that disabled artists are still artists, and that art can help people in so many ways.


Here's some of my digital art and some pieces of jewellery I've produced. and you can see more on my DeviantArt at http://unclefrogface.deviantart.com/

 

 


Why I need help

As you may or may not know, the cost of art materials isn't cheap, and to sell items, I want them to be of good quality. The money raised will go towards:

  • art materials (paints, canvas, clay, resin, wood etc.)
  • website start up and running costs
  • Advertising
  • Studio space (if costs allow) 


What this means to me

This will give me a whole new lease of life and the chance to make my own income. It's difficult to put into words just how much this would change my life. With the income from my art sales, I could buy a decent wheelchair rather than use an NHS one. I could start giving back to community by getting back to charity work and hopefully in the future some light teaching. It really would change my life.

 
 

How else can you help?

Thank you to everyone who has helped so far. i am so greateful to you all. Not everyone has the money to donate, I understand. You can also help with your support by simply following me on twitter @unclefrogface and by sharing this campaign via twitter, facebook and google+

story:
Print and Design simply done. We offer the whole shebang: graphic design, offset and digital printing and mailing services. With a team of awesomely rad and experienced designers, we can provide you with the top-notch quality design typically reserved for those who invest in costly design studios. Print is not dead! Now more than ever, we long for a tactile experience in this digital age. 

When we launched Simply Print on Tuesday, July 21st, 2015, we had planned to slowly ease into the business. Do it the right way, gather up the money, find an office space, purchase new computers and upgrade our software. Circumstances had forced our hand, causing us to launch a month ahead of schedule. It didn't seem like a big deal at the time, but after the first day it quickly became apparent that our services were in high demand (we aren't complaining). We had hit the ground running without even realizing it. 

We gathered together with our laptops in Megan's spare room, and set off on our adventure. After our first week running, we have emptied our bank accounts and maxed out our credit cards, and decided it is time to finally finish and launch that IndieGoGo campaign we had started.

Your contributions will not only help us with all the start up costs needed to get our company the kick start it needs, but it will also allow our husbands, family and friends to sleep better at night. Have you tried sleeping next to someone who tosses and turns all night? Yeah, not fun.

Besides happy husbands, your funding will go towards helping us with the following:

  • New Computers: Megan has a desktop that is older than a kindergartner, Tammy and Aleksandra have laptops that have seen better days, and all three computers are hanging on for their dear life. 
  • Upgraded Software: The only thing almost as important as a new computer is updated software. Adobe InDesign, Photoshop and Illustrator to be exact.
  • Office Supplies: We need printers, paper, trash cans, boxes, and shipping supplies. Seriously, you can only reuse a paper bag from Target so many times.
  • Design Essentials: Our clients deserve a bit more than fonts downloaded for free from DaFont.com and images downloaded from Google image search. Your funding will go towards expanding our font library and purchasing a subscription to a stock image website.
  • Printing Costs: Until we are able to establish credit with our vendors, most of them require payment up front or upon delivery. We don't want to make all of our clients pay that way, so your funding will help fill in the gap between paying our vendors, and giving our clients time to get together money to pay us. 
  • The Boring Stuff: Permits, licenses and numbers all cost money. We don't like doing things that are illegal (if we do, it has to be fun), and have no plans of our lives being like an episode of Orange is the New Black, so funding will go towards making sure that we are staying in line. Some of these items were already purchased using our own money, so you'd be helping to pay us back.

*Final design for products are still pending.

Don't have the money to help us out? We totally understand. Below are some ways you can help out, without donating money.
  • Like us on Facebook and follow us Instagram.
  • Share our IndieGoGo campaign with your friends and family.
  • Share our Facebook and Instagram with your friends and family.
  • Keep us in mind for your next design or print project.
  • Tell your boss about us for your company's printing and design needs.


Megan has about a decade of experience in the printing industry. In 2010, she graduated from College of the Canyons in Computer Media Design and since then her expertise has grown into numerous fields such as print production, mailing services, marketing and production management. Megan adores her two cats, runs her own Etsy shop, and you can probably find her on the weekends at the comic book store.

Tammy is finishing up her Design Communication Art program at UCLA Extension, but has been working as a graphic designer for the past few years. She is detail-oriented, proficient and accommodating to her clients. She has always loved creating, and especially enjoys helping others create their vision. Tammy is addicted to all things covered in chocolate, is a fan of all colors, and spends her weekends binge watching on Netflix.

In 2012, Aleksandra graduated from Pasadena City College in Digital Media. She is always enthusiastic towards her clients and helpful in aiding production work. Aleksandra also has a very creative eye and it shows in her work. She has a bubbly personality, loves a good cup of thai tea, and adventures with her spunky two-year old daughter on the weekends.

Even though we are just starting out, it is important to the three of us to give back. We are grateful for the food in our fridges, the roofs over our heads, and our access to clean water. We are all relatively healthy, and don't live in a country where we spend every day fearing for our lives. 
Unfortunately, there are plenty of people in the world who do not have those things, and we feel the desire to reach out and give back. We are already working with a few local non-profits where we are fully donating our design services, or we are donating a portion of our design services. We want to continue to do so, and eventually in the future, we hope to be able to actually donate money each month to charities we are passionate about.

We want to continue to do so, and eventually in the future, we hope to be able to actually donate money each month to charities we are passionate about.

story:
About GoodWorks Coffee & Tea

GoodWorks is a social enterprise dedicated to empowering people with every bag of coffee or tea sold. We invest 100% of our profits into building vocational training centers for orphans and other disadvantaged people across the globe.

We've been so grateful for all the support these past two years, and thanks to you it's time to build our own GoodWorks : Roastery and Tasting Room. 

For two years we've partnered with local coffee roasters to use their facilities and expertise. While this has been a great start for us, we're at the point where we need to grow. Our Roastery & Tasting Room will have a 6-7lb. roaster. We believe that by keeping a small roaster, we can better control the quality of each roast. We're also rolling out new packaging that shares our mission and passion for empowering people. The Roastery will also house a tea blending workshop, perfect for making batches of Songhua or Tortuga. 

For us, growing is not simply a desire, it's a necessity. In order to continue empowering orphans, we need to grow our facilities to ensure that no orphan has to go without education, vocational training and recreation.  


What We Need & What You Get

Because our people-over-profit model, GoodWorks invests it's profits into programs for orphans and the disadvantaged, which leaves little room for our vital expansion. That's why we need your help to help us grow! And while you're helping us grow, you're also getting some great perks like :

  • Directly traded coffees and teas
  • Sweet tees, posters and coffee mugs
  • Private tastings and event tickets

The Impact

With our new Roastery and Tasting Room you'll finally have a place to come visit us, grab some great fresh roasted coffee and learn more about where your coffee is grown, and how we make your cup so delicious! We'll also be able to host sweet events like public cuppings, brewing demos and workshops for the coffee novice and enthusiasts. 


Risks & Challenges

As with anything, there's some risk involved. While we've secured the perfect location, there can always be minor delays and slight changes in the plans. But rest assured that if any major changes happen, you'll be the first to know. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't back us up? Don't worry! We would love it if you could "share" about our campaign with your friends and family! Use all of your favorite social media to help us reach our goal! We're active on : 

  • Facebook  - /goodworkscoffeeandtea
  • Instagram - @goodworkscoffee
  • Twitter - @goodworkscoffee

Thanks again! We can't wait to grow with you and provide you with the most impactful cups of coffee!

story:
Short Summary

   My name is Michael Otten and I live in Kalispell, Montana. My friend is the owner of a local Book Store called "Kalispell Comics" which deals in art, literature and collectibles.

   Without sharing personal details; he is having hard times made even harder since the store isn't getting enough attention despite having a good downtown location. My girlfriend and I are hoping to raise funds to build a bright, professional looking street sign to boost customer base and interest.

What We Need & What You Get

   I'm an artist and designer and have already created an original high resolution sign graphic we believe will work well. Any contributors who don't wish to remain anonymous will be thanked and recognized with their names written on the inside of the sign.

How your funding will be used:
  • Locally print graphic on vinyl and have applied to sturdy sandwich-board signage probably weather-proofed wood.
  • Buy city permit to place sign on Kalispell Main Street corner during the week.
  • Remaining funds (if any) will be given to the store directly to be used at their discretion for promoting or maintaining the business.

Your Impact

   These funds will help get a local business really going -- Kalispell is a rapidly growing industrial and tourist center near the border to Canada where the arts are well supported, and Kalispell Comics is the only store of its kind in the area! This sign will be displayed right on Main Street Downtown where thousands of people drive every day -- most of whom probably don't even know the store exists yet.

   Even if you don't live near or visit the area, if you love comics or support local businesses or the arts, we will be so so grateful for even a few dollars in aid.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help get the word around, but let's keep this a secret!! I would like to surprise the owner if possible, so please share it directly with individuals or organizations you think might be interested and not too publicly in case my friend sees it prematurely.

Thank you very much for taking the time to read this!

~Michael O.
