story:
OBON 2015: 70 years-70 flags

The mission of OBON 2015 is to help veterans, their families, and other citizens, return Yosegaki Hinomaru (Good Luck Flag) that were taken from Japanese soldiers in WWII following battles.  WWII Veterans and OBON2015 co-founders Rex and Keiko Ziak will reunite flags with families and communities in Japan 

OBON 2015 will return to Japan in August 2015, Seventy Flags in recognition of the Seventy Years having passed since the end of the hostilities between Japan and America.  The American families want these personal items returned to Japan and family members who have not had reconciliation .

OBON 2015 co-founders will travel to Japan during OBON season (August 1 to 14, 2015) to return seventy Yosegaki Hinomaru representing the seventy years of peace. OBON 2015 has made arrangements to return flags, traveling with 7 distinguished veterans of WWII, whose intent is to promote peace and reconciliation between our two countries.

We Need Your Help

If you can contribute any amount to help cover the cost of travel and accommodations for these veterans, we would greatly appreciate your financial support.  OBON 2015 is an affiliate of Astoria Visual Arts,a 501(C)3 non-profit organization and donations are tax deductible.  (AVA/OBON 2015,  P.O. Box 282  Astoria, Oregon 97103)

In appreciation of contributions your name will be listed in our monthly newsletter http://obon2015.com/obon-2015-newsletter.html.  Contribution of $1000 or more will receive a First Addition DVD of  OBON 2015: 70 years-70 flags directed and filmed by Emmy award winner Rex Ziak.

story:
"Among internet users 65+, 53% use the internet or e-mail"  -- Pew Research, 2012

We are a start-up, working with automated devices. We were developing a digital key management system but found that there is just too much competition. During that project, we were working on a side-project teaching seniors how to use computers and technology. 

Seniors want to learn technology, but they are too scared to use it and no one is there is show them how to use it! Additionally, most independent and assisted living homes aren't equipped with WiFi for the residents.

Since we started this project about 2 years ago, we recognized very quickly that this demographic can't connect with their loved-ones and the world. Many of our clients never even used a computer before or think its a terrible thing. 

"Among internet users in the G.I. generation+, 34% use the internet or e-mail"  -- Pew Research, 2012


Technology For Seniors

  • We are looking to raise $50,000 to purchase tablets (or Chromebooks), including a WiFi hotspot to give seniors access to the web. 
  • If you want to get personal with your contribution, purchase a tablet to give to a senior citizen, who has never owned an electronic device before. 
  • If we don't reach our goal, then we will buy as many devices as we can to get seniors connected to the web!

Help Improve the Health of Senior Citizens

  • Let's get the lost generation connected to the their loved-ones and beyond! Contributing to this project is the first step in helping us bring more advanced technology to independent and assisted living homes and more, that seniors can interact with to improve their health and lifestyle.
  • While working with the basics with a generation that has no knowledge of how the web works, we will be exploring ways to automate health care that allows medical professionals to monitor vital signs in real team. 

Help Improve their Computer Skills

  • The 65+ age group are the easier targets because they lack the most computer skills and internet skill. They are also trust strangers more, so are more opt to fall victim of an internet scam.
  • We have been working on this project for about two years and we have been able to successfully introduce what the web has to offer and give lessons about important topics such as phishing e-mails, viruses and malware, social media and staying connected with loved-ones. 

Risks & Challenges

  • When it comes to health care, there are many regulations in place that may now allow to produce a system that is for the benefit of others. We will work with regulators and physicians to develop a way keeping real time health data available. 
  • It all starts with the user. In order for us to understand how seniors interact with technology, we first need to get them to use it. Some seniors simply do not want anything to do with technology, so we have to help break that negative perception.

story:
We've been asked to "Go National" - And we need your help!

The Experience Pros Radio Show and their unique brand of Positive. Business. Talk.™ isn't just an idea.  It's an award-winning, ever-growing and very successful major market radio show broadcasting for the last 6.5 years in Denver, Colorado. We have been named the "most positive business talk show in America" by Dr. Ivan Misner (founder of BNI, the world's largest business networking group) and endorsed by Dave Ramsey (syndicated radio talk show host on 500+ stations. CLICK HERE to Hear Dave's Support of Experience Pros) and Bob Burg (co-author of the NY Times Best-selling Go-Giver series of books).

National Syndicator BizTalk Radio has approached us to become the new 8AM-10AM Featured Morning Show for their network, and will work to develop our presence across their more than 300 affiliate radio stations in the US.  

Not Just Radio... A Supportive Community of Small Business Owners
More than just a radio show, we have seamlessly coupled our daily broadcast with an online business directory, The Extreme Customer Service Directory.  Currently we service 150+ businesses in the Colorado market. However, we are poised and ready to launch and care for membership services in every market the radio show airs.

Here's the Business Plan:
Key markets represented by BizTalk Radio include Portland, Atlanta, San Diego, Boston, Detroit, Dallas, Seattle, Columbus, Raleigh, Richmond, Hartford and Spokane.  Secondary markets include (but are not limited to) Tampa, Charleston, Johnson City, Jefferson City, Lompoc and many more.

As we build our network of affiliate stations for the 8AM-10AM two-hour show, we will also be offering a 1-hour "best-of" weekend broadcast to many other stations during Saturdays 6PM-7PM time slot. Markets that BizTalk Radio would pitch the weekend show to include (but are not limited to) Oklahoma City, Wichita, Daytona Beach, Eugene-Springfield, Tupelo, Stamford, Mobile, Safford, Shelton and many more.

With every new market we open, we will simultaneously open a corresponding regional chapter of the Extreme Customer Service Directory, offering a National Level Membership for only $250 for an ENTIRE YEAR.  We will manage memberships via our existing full time staff, and will hire Regional Membership Directors as the need arises.

We Need Your Help!
We seek to raise at least $100,000 to cover the expense of paying the syndicator to bring Positive. Business. Talk.™ all across the country, and to develop the infrastructure of our Extreme Customer Service Directory™.

story:
Buffalo Bore Factory Expansion

**PLEASE READ THE SPECIAL NOTE AT THE BOTTOM ABOUT THE PERKS


Buffalo Bore has begun getting requests to fill contract and high volume orders that we cannot currently handle for the lack of high-volume production machinery. 

We can easily qualify for big-bank loans to acquire this machinery but, we would rather give the perks to the INDIEGOGO crowdfunding public than to banks who, in our opinion, already get too many perks and control too much of our nation's  and world's business.   

We see  INDIEGOGO as the PERFECT vehicle for this funding effort and we touch on these points in more detail in our introductory video above so, if you have not seen it; take a look and see Buffalo Bore like it has never been revealed before.

  • Buffalo Bore began about 17 years ago in Salmon, Idaho. 
  • We worked hard and earned our good name in high-performance products and are now well known in the industry which distinction is creating new kinds of opportunities.
  • Last year Buffalo Bore was approved for exports into Canada which has opened the global market to us.  In order to meet the demands stemming from these new opportunities, we must expand.

We Must Expand to Meet New Demands

We want to offer the Perks, normally taken by banks in the form of interest, to go to the INDIEGOGO Crowdfunders instead.

  • In order to fill the high volume contract orders we are being asked to fill, we need several pieces of expensive production machinery which we show and explain in the video.  These new machines, with the custom tooling and dies that fit our highly specialized type of production requirements, will cost us about $750,000. 
  • We would like to give the INDIEGOGO crowdfunding public a chance to fund us and be the beneficiaries of the perks instead of the banks.
  • Even if we are not able to meet our $750,000 goal, we will gladly keep our perk commitments to all who contribute and we will do so with great gratitude.

If We Are Able to Reach Our Goal

You, the funder will have played a key part in expanding a US business in a time when our country is losing so much industry to foreign entities and did we mention that because of you, it will have been done without a loan from a big bank.

  • Personal, Local & National Preparedness is a very big part of what we are about and a successful expansion will only make us more proficient and able.
  • We have earned our reputation in the high performance products we make and the same ingenuity that went into the products that gained us recognition, will go into our higher production machinery so that we can offer our high-quality, high-performance products to a broader customer base.
  • Truth is, with you, we will grow much faster than without you.  Wouldn't it be nice if down the road you could say; "I helped fund that company."

Unlike New Startups, We Can & Will Deliver On Our Perks

We know that the banks will loan expansion money to us, with interest of course but, we highly prefer to fill our perk commitments to the INDIEGOGO crowdfunders instead!

  • About the only hurdles we foresee in meeting our perk commitments are filling large web orders immediately.  If this campaign goes super well, we may need a little bit of time to get some of the really big perks filled.
  • The nice thing is though; if the campaign goes well, we will have high volume production machinery in place to fill our big perk commitments more quickly!

If You Cannot Contribute.. but, Wait, You Can!
We realize that some people may want to contribute but, might not have the funds available.  If this is you; spreading the word will still be of great benefit to this campaign and you will have played a real and important part!

  • Get the word out and help us make this campaign a success.
  • Use the INDIEGOGO share tools in the upper left hand side of this page and we thank you in advance!
** IndieGoGo will be sending us all contributions from this campaign approximately 15 days after the campaign ends so, Perk Gift Certificates shown on the right side of this screen will not become valid or useable until August 10th, 2015.

story:
My Vision –

My vision is to make classical hatha yoga available to every human being in its full depth and dimension. With your help, we can raise $15,000 to fund a teacher-training program for two aspiring yoga teachers and myself. We will then travel to India and learn classical hatha yoga attaining the privilege and fulfillment to bringing this ancient science of complete well-being to more people.


Basic Overview -

Hello my name is Kashish Sarup! I’m an aspiring yoga teacher who spent her life growing up in India where yoga is a big part of the culture. After moving to the United States I went to various yoga studios and experienced all sorts of yoga. Much of the yoga I experienced here in the United States was different from what I had experienced in India. After encountering various distortions and seeing how yoga is largely limited to just the physical aspect of you who are, I have been inspired to go back to India for a teacher training program in Classical Hatha Yoga.  Along with me, two other aspiring yoga teachers will be traveling to India for an 8 month teacher training program. After completion we will come back to the San Francisco bay area and start our first yoga studio together.  After seeing yoga take on several changes, some which even have a harmful impact on ones system, my goal is to bring back hatha yoga in its most authentic form to America so one can experience life in a more profound and inclusive way.

More about Classical Hatha  Yoga - 

An asana is a posture. There are innumerable postures your body can take. Among these, certain postures have been identified as yogasanas. Yoga means that which takes you on to a higher dimension or higher perception of life. So, that kind of posture which leads you to a higher possibility is called a “yogasana.” The science of asanas is known as hatha yoga. “Ha” means sun, “ta” means moon. The first process of yoga is to bring balance between the masculine and feminine in you, without cultivating these two dimensions within us, there is no reaching towards the peak, there is no question of a human being flowering to his fullest possibility.

Right now, when you are trying to do hatha yoga, the biggest barrier is the limitations of your body. In fact, whatever human beings want to do, the biggest barrier is their body and mind. What should have been a stepping stone has turned into an obstacle, simply because they have not explored it considerably. After a profound and thorough exploration of the human system, the yogic system identified 84 asanas as yogasanas, 84 postures through which you can transform your body and mind into a great possibility for your ultimate wellbeing. 

Most other spiritual processes talk about putting down the body because the body is an obstacle. If you want to sit and meditate, your legs tell you, “I need to stretch. I need to walk.” When we ask you in the morning to stretch your body, you say, “No, I want to rest.” If you do an asana and we ask you to stretch, you say, “No, I don’t want to stretch.” But if we ask you to sit unmoving, your body wants to stretch. Likewise, it has to eat, it has to sleep, it has to relieve itself – the body needs so many things. By practicing classical hatha yoga, one will be able to touch the core of who they are. Once this happens, the body and mind will work to their full potential, making things like success, health, inner peace, and good relationships come naturally. 

 The most important thing for people who are seeking to be successful – whether in the corporate sector, in politics, in the military, or any other field – is balance. Only if you have a balance that is not disturbed by external situations, are you capable of making use of the competence and intelligence within you. Otherwise, even the most wonderful qualities that one may have will go waste, simply because of lack of balance. Hatha yoga brings this balance.

Where exactly is your money going? 

Your money will go to the classical Hatha Yoga teacher training program for myself and two other aspiring teachers. The School fees include 1750 hours of training ($5000 per student), accommodation, meals, training material, practice material, and post-training support.

If we exceed our goal, our money will be going to our start up costs for our first yoga studio in the San Francisco Bay area. How you and the community can benefit - Your physical health, your psychological wellbeing, and your spiritual possibility depend on how well aligned you are with existence. Essentially, Hatha yoga is a step towards establishing this alignment.” –Sadhguru

In addition to the innumerable physical, emotional, psychological, and spiritual benefits of hatha yoga, we will be offering various perks for your help. These perks include t-shirts, meditation music to help you relax, e-books related to yoga and the inner-nature, and free hatha yoga classes once we return to the United States from our training program.

How you can be involved –

- Keep checking our page for updates

- Share our campaign through Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter

- Spread the word in person, on the phone, or through emails.

- Stay involved; we want you to be a part of bringing classical hatha yoga to  America.

story:
The Cooperative 

Burritoville Solidarity Co-op is a non-profit restaurant and bar that provides healthy, local, organic food and beverage choices at affordable prices. Moreover, it is a space to live the cooperative experience by engaging in collective work and volunteer opportunities. Co-op burritoville offers alternative workshop space, a study area, a vibrant music and events scene, plus the best vegetarian burritos in the city!


The Project

We are in the process of transitioning a long time vegan/vegetarian resto bar in our community into a not-for-profit solidarity cooperative focused on maintaining a sustainable food and beverage option for the community in addition to creating a launchpad for other socially progressive and collective community projects.

Our Team

We are a community of people consisting of volunteers, students, university staff and faculty, worker members and user members that have been working tirelessly to rebuild the social systems (Food, Housing, Daycare, etc) in Montreal. Our goal is to turn this incredible historic three-story building into a hub of development for social transformation, while continuing to offer healthy, local food and beverages.
Our group has a wide spectrum of different expertise: artistic, agriculture, business administration, community development, education and engineering. This well rounded team has ensured the success of the project for over two years and now it is your chance to join us! 
Today, by supporting this project, you are helping university students and the community to engage in and develop collective systems as well as encouraging hands-on practice developing the skills needed to help build a world that corresponds with their ideas, values and life ambitions.

What We Need

We are passionate about sustainability and we need renovations! The building, while incredibly beautiful, needs a structural and aesthetic face lift. We will be investing in improvements to the energy efficiency of the space - Montreal winters are REALLY COLD - and we want the space to be warm and comfortable for people who are inside.  We will also be working on converting the two upper floors into collective working, cooking, and playing spaces. 

Our goal only represents a portion of the total cost of this project. We have already raised roughly $140,000 which has allowed us to transition the restaurant into a cooperative. We still need another $90,000 to reach our goals for transforming the entire space. 


The Impact

In our community over the last few years many small projects have arisen, and while some of them see great success, others don't have access to the resources to allow them to reach their full potential. The cooperative aims to change that! By supporting other local projects in our community, we will be contributing to the development of future leaders, the social economy, as well as imparting forward-looking values on a generation in need of creating alternative solutions to our current global issues. 

This is a small, yet genuinely important step; part of a much larger global movement working towards collective livelihood. We will be sharing what we learn through open-source practices and will work to develop best practices and benchmarks than can be taken and molded by other groups trying to establish similar projects in the future.

By supporting us you are not just helping out the exciting and diverse community in Montreal, but are also building towards a better world in a global capacity!


Risks & Challenges

We are aware of the complexities associated with running a restaurant in Montreal and have multiple strategies about how we can create strong resilience for the organization. By creating new streams of income such as Collective Kitchens, vegan/vegetarian catering, as well as developing strong local partnerships with our suppliers, and community members, we are ensuring growth and continuation of this project. 


Financial Donations & What You Get

Your donations would be greatly appreciated!  We have a ton of neat perks to say thank you for your generosity including:

  • Food, Drinks, and Memberships
  • Get your name written on a donation commemoration Fava Bean
  • Burritoville Burrito Recipe and DIY Kit!
  • Swag, Swag, Swag
  • Name a new menu item!
  • Downtown tour and Intimate Evening with our Chef
  • Room Commemoration Plaque

If you can't help financially...

There are still lots of other ways you can help!
  • Send this page out to all your friends and family using the Indiegogo share tools
  • Come volunteer, or join the cooperative development team! 
  • Contact us about material, equipment or in-kind donations (burritovilleproject@gmail.com)

story:
Short Summary

Supporting an organization called Million Dollar Smiles.  http://www.milliondollarsmiles.ca/

Million Dollar Smiles is a non-profit organization that exists to put smiles on the faces of children navigating life threatening illnesses and medical adversity in their everyday life.

The cumulative efforts of our loyal community of volunteers helps Million Dollar Smiles raise money to support gift-giving programs and special events for our MDS children and families.

Join us and make a difference in the life of a child.

Children have needless suffering and if we can give them a glimmer of hope, put a smile on their face and lighten up their day, then we have done our job!

When you help support a 'build' you are changing the life of a child who doesn't deserve to experience the pain and suffering that they endure on a daily basis.

What We Need & What You Get

Each playground costs $2500 to build and we wish to build one in August.  If you are in the local area and make a donation, you will be invited to help us on the day of the build.  You will actually get to help build the playground with us, get a t-shirt, lunch and meet other incredible people.

You will also get to meet the family and the child that you are helping and will be making a huge difference in their lives.

The Impact

Million Dollar Smiles has been bringing smiles to children's faces for years now and have done hundreds of builds.  They will be building 50 this summer alone!

Other Ways You Can Help

Million Dollar Smiles also hosts a Halloween Gala in Vaughan and various other smaller events.

I hope you will do your part and help put a smile on a childs face and take some of that suffering away!  Thank you for your support!

story:
THIS IS WHY ATHEISTS AND SKEPTICS NEED A COMMUNITY CENTER


United Church of Bacon wants to save Magician Penn Jillette's former home.......The Slammer ......and create The Nevatican!
The world's largest Skeptic and Atheist Community Center. 

 

Penn is the vocal half of the Las Vegas magic act Penn & Teller.

For twenty years The Slammer has been a retreat of reason in the desert and we want to keep it that way.

Penn has moved to a new family-friendly home in the suburbs, and we plan to keep developers from buying this historic and unique place just to knock it down to make room for cookie cutter houses. NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!

NOT ON OUR WATCH!
We have been working tirelessly to find a buyer for the land who will not use the surrounding area to create a suburban abomination.


WE HAVE SUCCEEDED IN THAT GOAL!

Penn has made a very generous offer to allow the United Church of Bacon
to buy The Slammer for less than the developers would pay....in fact he will allow us to only pay for operating costs, needed repairs, and improvements until we get established!!!!

THAT'S WHERE YOU COME IN!

We need 3 million dollars to buy, remodel, and maintain The Slammer, but we have set the fundraising goal at $500,000. 500 grand is the minimum we need to just maintain the property. The amount we raise will be the deciding factor so donors have the final word on whether we merely maintain or own.

 

We need your help to raise the funds required to purchase, remodel, and manage the property so that we can do something good for the atheist and skeptic communities.

WATCH AN INTERVIEW WITH PENN
You now have the chance to help do something amazing. You can help transform The Slammer into  the world's largest atheist community center,  The Nevatican.


WHAT IS THE UNITED CHURCH OF BACON?

The United Church of Bacon is a real, legal church based in Las Vegas, Nevada with over 12,000 members worldwide that was founded during a meeting at Penn Jillette's house in 2010 to fight discrimination against atheists. The official launch of the church was at The Amaz!ng Meeting, in 2012. They believe in practical atheism and ignore the existence of gods and chose a funny bacon name with an argument that bacon is demonstrably real whereas god is imperceptible by the eye. 

The United Church of Bacon opposes special privileges to religions on the grounds that religious people are somehow superior to inferior people for having strange beliefs, and promotes separation of church and state, science education and critical thinking, and an end to discrimination against atheists. For more information about the United Church of bacon, click HERE

 

With your donation, we can turn this beautiful property into the

WORLD'S LARGEST ATHEIST/SKEPTIC COMMUNITY CENTER.


The home is Penn Jillette's former retreat, called The Slammer. The brightly colored house is architecturally unique. It has been featured on over a dozen television shows and it has won three local American Institute of Architects awards. It's set on 8.5 acres in Las Vegas 15 minutes from the strip.

With 7,500 square feet The Slammer has 7 bedrooms and 10 bathrooms, movie theatre, steam room, hot tub, 25-yard lap pool, two kitchens, and comes decorated with artwork on loan from the Jillette family. It's the home of Vintage Nude Studios, and a fully operational recording studio.

The Slammer also features a giant courtyard for events of 200 people or more, with an amazing view of the desert and beautiful gardens!

 

WE ONLY HAVE UNTIL THE END OF THE YEAR TO RAISE FUNDS.

SO PLEASE HELP THE UNITED CHURCH OF BACON

MAKE THE SLAMMER ITS HOME!


   

That's okay with us! We're not opposed to you having a religion.

You don't have to live in Nepal to send disaster relief to Nepal. You don't have to be gay to support same-sex marriage. And you don't need to be a nonbeliever to recognize that atheists and skeptics are marginalized. Atheists just want to be treated with dignity and respect.

 

 

WE DON'T SEEK TO CONVERT ANYONE!
We just want to end discrimination and advocate for
SCIENCE AND RATIONAL THOUGHT!
Those are goals you can get behind whether you are religious or not!

 

We only have 2016 to plan and raise funds for the community center. If we fail, our property investors won't have a reason to rescue the place from developers. This opportunity will be gone.

That's why we need your urgent help, and your participation too. The best way for us to know how to serve you is to invite you to take part!

Each event the community center holds should pay for itself, but we'll also want to allow community groups to use the space in ways that don't bring in cash. We have renovations to make, cash flow to manage, and we'll be able to reach further with an endowment to cover overhead. Renovations will be performed with minimal change to the house, to better preserve this historic and architecturally important home.


WE'LL NEED TO:

  • Purchase a stage, a sound system, and seating for performances and weddings
  • Cover operational costs, including utilities, cleaning, and insurance
  • Build parking areas, a new roof and make upgrades to the house
  • Promote events, which will be critical to raising awareness, with photography and videography, through the website, social media, and directly to the press
  • Fund live webcasting of targeted events to engage with the wider world
  • Hire staff to manage the property, nurture donor relationships, partner with community groups, and organize events

Together we are going to change millions of lives for the better.

Stop the bulldozers. Help us build world's largest atheist community center!

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

 

How will you spend the money?

If we raise $500,000, we will have the minimum funding to operate, make required improvements and repairs for 3-4 years.  Additional funding over $500,000 will allow the United Church of Bacon to buy equity in the surrounding land from established investors, and further promote the community center. The United Church of Bacon will establish a seven to nine person board to control spending and management. 

What will you do with the money if you cannot raise enough?

If we don't meet our goal to raise enough funds to keep The Slammer, the United Church of Bacon, after Indiegogo and start up costs are paid, plans to buy a less expensive property or donate the money to one or a few of our selected charities.

Is my donation really tax deductible?

Yes, the amount you donate minus the estimated value of the reward you receive (you can estimate it yourself) is tax deductible, if you live in the United States. The United Church of Bacon is a real, legal church, which makes it automatically tax exempt for donations. We are also applying to become a 501(c)3 charity as well. We will be completely transparent and give more to charity than the majority of churches.

When will I get my perk?

We'll rush all items out to donors as soon as the fundraiser ends. We are unpaid volunteers, but will work to get you your perk as soon as possible.

I donated to get a t-shirt , how will you know what size to send me?

We'll contact you by email to get your t-shirt size.

How can I contact you?

We'd love to hear from you! For questions email info@unitedchurchofbacon.org.

 

GALLERY OF PERKS

FREEDOM OF EXPRESSION BRICKS

Depending on how many are sold, we will either be building an exterior wall of bricks or tiling walls within the Nevatican with personalized tiles. Once the fundraiser is completed, we will contact donors who've chosen this perk with details of our final plan and to finalize what you would like engraved on your free expression brick/tile.

BACON EBOOK OF LOGICAL QUOTES


P.H.D. IN BACONOLOGY


UNHOLY JILL-JET™ WATER


HOLY BOOK VOUCHER


 

LIMITED EDITION UNITED CHURCH OF BACON T-SHIRT

       

GET OUT OF HELL FREE CARD


PRAISE THE LARD!
story_txt:
THIS IS WHY ATHEISTS AND SKEPTICS NEED A COMMUNITY CENTER


United Church of Bacon wants to save Magician Penn Jillette's former home.......The Slammer ......and create The Nevatican!
			The world's largest Skeptic and Atheist Community Center. 



			 

			Penn is the vocal half of the Las Vegas magic act Penn & Teller.

			For twenty years The Slammer has been a retreat of reason in the desert and we want to keep it that way.

			Penn has moved to a new family-friendly home in the suburbs, and we plan to keep developers from buying this historic and unique place just to knock it down to make room for cookie cutter houses. NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!



NOT ON OUR WATCH!



			We have been working tirelessly to find a buyer for the land who will not use the surrounding area to create a suburban abomination.





WE HAVE SUCCEEDED IN THAT GOAL!

				Penn has made a very generous offer to allow the United Church of Bacon
to buy The Slammer for less than the developers would pay....in fact he will allow us to only pay for operating costs, needed repairs, and improvements until we get established!!!!







THAT'S WHERE YOU COME IN!


				We need 3 million dollars to buy, remodel, and maintain The Slammer, but we have set the fundraising goal at $500,000. 500 grand is the minimum we need to just maintain the property. The amount we raise will be the deciding factor so donors have the final word on whether we merely maintain or own.
 

We need your help to raise the funds required to purchase, remodel, and manage the property so that we can do something good for the atheist and skeptic communities.

WATCH AN INTERVIEW WITH PENN


			You now have the chance to help do something amazing. You can help transform The Slammer into  the world's largest atheist community center,  The Nevatican.






WHAT IS THE UNITED CHURCH OF BACON?

				The United Church of Bacon is a real, legal church based in Las Vegas, Nevada with over 12,000 members worldwide that was founded during a meeting at Penn Jillette's house in 2010 to fight discrimination against atheists. The official launch of the church was at The Amaz!ng Meeting, in 2012. They believe in practical atheism and ignore the existence of gods and chose a funny bacon name with an argument that bacon is demonstrably real whereas god is imperceptible by the eye. 

				The United Church of Bacon opposes special privileges to religions on the grounds that religious people are somehow superior to inferior people for having strange beliefs, and promotes separation of church and state, science education and critical thinking, and an end to discrimination against atheists. For more information about the United Church of bacon, click HERE

				 


				With your donation, we can turn this beautiful property into the

WORLD'S LARGEST ATHEIST/SKEPTIC COMMUNITY CENTER.




				The home is Penn Jillette's former retreat, called The Slammer. The brightly colored house is architecturally unique. It has been featured on over a dozen television shows and it has won three local American Institute of Architects awards. It's set on 8.5 acres in Las Vegas 15 minutes from the strip.

				With 7,500 square feet The Slammer has 7 bedrooms and 10 bathrooms, movie theatre, steam room, hot tub, 25-yard lap pool, two kitchens, and comes decorated with artwork on loan from the Jillette family. It's the home of Vintage Nude Studios, and a fully operational recording studio.


				The Slammer also features a giant courtyard for events of 200 people or more, with an amazing view of the desert and beautiful gardens!

				 

WE ONLY HAVE UNTIL THE END OF THE YEAR TO RAISE FUNDS.


SO PLEASE HELP THE UNITED CHURCH OF BACON

MAKE THE SLAMMER ITS HOME!

You don't have to live in Nepal to send disaster relief to Nepal. You don't have to be gay to support same-sex marriage. And you don't need to be a nonbeliever to recognize that atheists and skeptics are marginalized. Atheists just want to be treated with dignity and respect.

story:
To Love and Be Loved

 

Sunday, July 12th ~ A cool and overcast day of hiking in the Donner Pass area, the sweet scent of pine and forest duff wafting strong as vistas of granite peaks opened up at seemingly each turn.

In that rich mountain air I was breathing in plentiful gratitude. As this campaign winds down with two days left, it is apparent that we will not make our “goal”. And yet that is such a misconception!

I am grateful for the many who have donated here but also for those who have contributed outside of this campaign. Like my grandchildren in the above photo, I am leaping for joy because we WILL have the materials to build our stage and to put beautiful curtains behind it. We will have the volunteer labor to reconfigure the layout of this bookstore. And we will come close to fulfilling the vision originally set forth here.

And that’s not to say that more contributions would not be appreciated! Of course they would be! But the success of this campaign is in its participation from so many.

To Love and Be Loved is my soul’s desire, and that feels fulfilled by you all! Thank You So Much! 

 

What Every Community Needs!

Is it a bookstore? A meeting hall? A cafe? A dance house? A performance center? Yes! You are invited to come by and read, converse, buy, sing, play, dance, recite, sip fine coffees and other beverages and ... be together.  The telling and sharing, the singing and acting, the dreaming up of stories and strategies and ideas -- that's what this campaign is all about. It's a community hub!

Hi! My name is Nory Fussell and I'm stoked to be here at The Open Book! 

Music heals! Art heals! Versatility heals!

The Open Book, a quality used book store, will also be an intimate and affordable community-oriented performance hall like no other in the area. You will enjoy a wide variety of events, many of which will be offered by donation. Events such as:

  • a monthly Travelogue Night hosted by your traveling Nevada County neighbors
  • open mics at which you can play for, listen to and be heard by your community 
  • Learning Lunches offered by talented folks with something special to teach
  • a seasonal Council of Elders for learning from our treasured Wise Ones
  • a monthly concert to benefit Hospitality House, the local homeless shelter 
  • many other activities, town hall meetings, rallies ... you name it, you can host it!

This bookstore, formerly Tomes, has rolling bookshelves which can be moved aside to create seating space for an audience of up to 80, a comfortable cabaret setting, or even a good sized dance floor. A sturdy and elevated 16' x 8' stage will be built. Rolling panels, upon which local artists can hang their works, will double as an attractive proscenium behind which the shelves and tables can be concealed to offer a more classic backdrop to events for your enjoyment.

In order to make way for an abundant new inventory of fresh books, The Open Book will be "compressed", creating a more open feel and freeing up space for more retail sales in the adjoining coffee shop, Sierra Mountain Coffee Roasters. With books in the cafe and cafe tables in the bookstore, this has been, and will continue to be, a very successful symbiotic relationship. 

About the New Owner

I have lived in the foothills of Nevada County, California, for 35 years, raising my family here and, for most of those years, enjoying a vibrant healing arts practice while developing friendships and support that continue to deepen and amaze me. Being active in various community groups, I've also produced and attended many a concert, rally and meeting at this bookstore and so have an excellent working relationship with the staff.

From a very early age, one of my recurring dreams is of a huge gathering, everyone I know in festivity under the shade of an acre-wide Banyan Tree, children climbing the branches while underneath the folk are singing and dancing, enjoying music and food everywhere. Friends now express support and excitement for this bookstore project, saying, "What a perfect place for you, Nory!" 

About the Money 

Right back into the community! Your contributions to this project will have an impact on the creativity, knowledge and dreams of our community that are impossible to measure! Kids, adults, all ages, will be uplifted by your support.
Some fine and talented people are helping me with computer technologies, video production, art, construction, labor ...  all of this. Bless their hearts that, in most cases, I am getting the "buddy discount". That said, here follows an estimated tally:
  • Stage Materials            $600
  • Paint/hardware              400
  • Lights/electrical             700
  • Panels/hardware           500
  • Plants                                200
  • Chairs                                500
  • Labor                               1000
  • Computer/tech help   1000
  • Marketing                       1000
  • Inventory                           400
  • Web design                       400
  • Signage                              400
  • Artwork/logo                    500
  • Licensing/fees                 700
 Funds that exceed our Goal will go towards the next level of improvements such as sound baffling for the rear wall, new microphones and the inevitable unforeseen.

About the Risks

For almost thirty years, I've been a one-on-one, self-employed person. Retail is new to me and technology is not my first language -- it is a challenge but I have tremendous support and am learning quickly. As electronic reading devices are changing the way many people read, some bookstores are closing their doors. But like in massage, "there is no substitute for the human touch",  and electronic devices do not build community hubs. People, face to face, do.

Q & A

How will you make money offering events "by donation"? We live in a very generous community. Those who can contribute more usually do. That said, not all events will be by donation.

What if you don't make your goal? I'm committed to improving this space. If we don't reach the goal, these changes will happen over years instead of weeks. As you can see, I am not afraid to ask for help, but this project sure would be sweet as an extended community endeavor.

How else can I help? Contribute to this campaign by spreading the word in any way you can, especially by sending the Indiegogo link to your friends. And remember -- The Open Book is your community venue! When it's time for you to host an event, consider what we have to offer here.

Help make the world a better place, one gift at a time. Support The Open Book.

story:
Half a year ago my best friend Kim went on a travel to Australia. First she had a stop in Indonesia and she loved it there. During this time it was very cold and dark in the Netherlands and I felt very depressed every time I saw her pictures from the beautiful country and especially the good weather. I am not proud to say it, but I even felt a bit jealous and sometimes did not really liked to hear her stories because I felt sad about my life at that moment. After some time she went to Australia, she wanted to go work there. However, Kim did not really like it in there that much. She was bored and could not find a job. In the end she found one, worked in the desert for weeks just to be able to pay back a flight to Bali, Indonesia. In the meanwhile, the weather became better in the Netherlands so I was able to talk with her again about everything we were facing in our day to day life. Now, half a year later she is in Indonesia again, chasing after her dream. But after such a long time of traveling, she is starting to feel far away from home and the friends she can always count on (I am trying to be one of them, but it's normally the other way around when I am drunk again once and I am trying to rape her in a taxi). And it's not only that she misses home, home also misses her. I am missing our coffee and cappuccino-muffin moments at the Douwe Egbert's coffeeplace in Maastricht, where we always discuss all the fun and shit that is going on in our difficult adolescence lives. I also miss the interventions I get from her, when she is telling me I cannot always get drunk, which is normally followed by a drunk night in which we are going to dance at a stripper-pole. Just for fun. 

The goal of my project is therefore to get my best friend back to the Netherlands. The problem is that she doesn't have any money at the moment and she doesn't want to put this problem on her parents. She is a very independent girl. My goal is to be able to drink a coffee and eat a cappuccino-muffin with her within one month, and therefore I need your help. Think about your best friend, and what it would mean not to be able to have a regular chat with this important person. In the next week, I'll go around the Netherlands, and ask people about their best friends. BRING MY BEST FRIEND BACK!


Risks: Maybe Kim will miss her flight in the end. Than we are fucked. 

Challenges: Maybe she falls in love within a month, and get married and get babies and never get back anymore.

story:
You Can Make the 2015 Liberian Marathon a Reality \\

In response to the tragic Ebola outbreak, the annual Liberian Marathon was cancelled. Here in Liberia, runners crave the opportunity to celebrate Liberia’s resilience and triumphant spirit, but the funding is simply not available.

Give Liberians a Chance to Celebrate \\

We're a team of committed volunteers ready to put on the most anticipated event of the year. In the wake of the Ebola crisis, we want to help bring back the normalcy that people desire and deserve.

The mission of the Liberia Marathon is to promote athletics, community cohesion, national peace and unity. Since 2011 it has been a source of national pride for all.

"Liberian President Sirleaf says the marathon symbolizes the country's upward journey, the fact that it's stable and safe enough to host such a big event." -NPR

The Press Loves the Marathon \\

Read more in Running Times, the New York Times and the Guardian.

Race Day is Magical \\  

With humidity close to 100% and warm temperatures, incomplete infrastructure, and beautiful landscapes, the Liberian Marathon is a challenging, world-class experience for all.

Our goal is to ensure that the more than 2,000 registered participants can compete in Liberia’s capital city of Monrovia on November 8th.

The main event this year will be a half-marathon, along with a 10km race - the only 10km in West Africa that includes participants in wheelchairs and on crutches. With the cost to enter subsidised for locals at roughly $1.00, race day will be epic.

$30,000 Makes Race Day Possible \\

One month before the scheduled race in 2014 – Ebola hit the country hard. But now we’re ready to run on November 8th. We had to start from scratch. 

With $30,000 dollars, our team can make the marathon events a reality. That's where you come in. 

Get Amazing Perks for Backing the Marathon \\

We’re offering perks you won't want to do without, from reusable water bottles to tote bags to organic cotton t-shirts Made in Liberia. 

Made in Liberia Organic Cotton T-Shirts. The 100% African Organic Cotton T-Shirt is casual, comfortable, and sustainable - a necessary for every closet. These shirts are available in styles for women (above left) and men (above right). You can choose from black, white or grey in sizes S to XXL. And don't miss the chance to get a branded BPA free aluminum reusable water bottle, or a Liberian Marathon tote. This gear is an Indiegogo exclusive, so don't wait!

The Marathon is a Chance to Run Ahead, Move Forward \\

The races are different from other marathons. Serious long-distance athletes run alongside non-athletes ranging from women that run market stands to Liberia’s President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf. Each finisher goes home with the coveted Liberia Marathon medal, incredible memories and an enduring sense of pride. Bill Clinton called the marathon "an embodiment of peace, unity and achievement."

Oliver Belogory took part in the 10k race for amputees. "I used to be a fighter," he said. "But now I am running alongside my people. I feel part of society again." -The Guardian, 2013

Everyone Can Get Involved and Connected \\

The 2015 Marathon will be run in memory of those who lost their lives and to those who survived the Ebola tragedy. Together we can make the Liberian Marathon a reality, and push forward.

Even if you can't contribute, you can participate by 

(1) registering to run the marathon here; 

(2) sharing this page on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter and 

(3) emailing three of your friends who you think may want to make this a reality.

Please like us on Facebook. Follow us on Twitter. Visit our Website. For press enquiries or other questions, please email us directly at LiberiaMarathon2015@gmail.com. We would be delighted to hear from you.
story_txt:
You Can Make the 2015 Liberian Marathon a Reality \\


In response to the tragic Ebola outbreak, the annual Liberian Marathon was cancelled. Here in Liberia, runners crave the
opportunity to celebrate Liberia’s resilience and triumphant spirit, but the
funding is simply not available. 


Give Liberians a Chance to Celebrate \\


We're a team of committed volunteers
ready to put on the most anticipated event of the year. In the wake of the Ebola crisis, we want to help bring back the
normalcy that people desire and deserve. 
The mission of the Liberia Marathon is to promote athletics, community cohesion, national peace and unity. Since 2011 it has been a source of national pride for all.
"Liberian President Sirleaf says the marathon symbolizes
the country's upward journey, the fact that it's stable and safe enough to host
such a big event." -NPR
The Press Loves the Marathon \\




  



  

Read more in Running Times, the New York Times and the Guardian.

Race Day is Magical \\  
With humidity close to 100% and warm temperatures, incomplete infrastructure, and beautiful
landscapes, the Liberian Marathon is a challenging, world-class experience for
all.
Our goal is to ensure that the more than 2,000
registered participants can compete in Liberia’s capital city of Monrovia on
November 8th. 

The main event this year will be a half-marathon, along with a 10km race - the only 10km in West Africa that includes 
participants in
wheelchairs and on crutches. With the cost to enter subsidised for locals at roughly $1.00, race
day will be epic. 



$30,000 Makes Race Day Possible \\

One month before the scheduled race in 2014 – Ebola hit the country hard. But now we’re ready to run on November 8th. We had to start from scratch. 
With $30,000 dollars, our team can make the marathon events a reality. That's where you come in.

story:
UPDATE 2/16

The Hive Butler will be a vendor at the Indiana Beekeeping School, on Feb. 27.  We are also trying to get signed up for the Tri-County Bee Conference in Wooster, Ohio on March 5.  And the Michigan Spring Bee Conference in East Lansing on March 11 and 12.  We will be at the Will County Spring Bee School in Joliet, IL on 4/2 and possibly the West Virginia Spring Bee School in Chapmanville, WV on 4/9.

We are still working on a prototype.  The Hive Butler is a big box, beyond what a 3-d printer can do well.  We are working with another prototype manufacturer currently, but will be taking $20 pre-orders at all the shows.  We may end up going straight to production without ever having a prototype.  

The tool to produce the Hive Butler will take around 6 weeks to be ready, and from there on we will be delivering your Hive Butlers as we visit your summer conferences.  

We would love to hear from you, to let us know where you'd like us to meet up with your beek friends!  Hope to see you soon!



UPDATE!


While our campaign is far from funded, our efforts are ongoing!  We know there are a lot of beekeepers interested in the Hive Butler.  We've heard from you, all over the globe.  

We are currently working with some engineering students at Purdue University on producing a prototype on a 3D printer.  We are hoping to have that with us at the Beekeepers of Indiana Bee School, on February 27, in Indianapolis.


We are also working on gathering some private funding, but will be re-running our Indiegogo campaign next month.  By that time, we should have the prototype available for video, and you beekeepers should be thinking more about honey production.


THE HIVE BUTLER WILL BE COMING TO YOUR STATE CONVENTION in 2016!  If you have a beeschool or club meeting that you would like to invite us to, please reach out to us at www.hivebutler.com, or on FB or Twitter.

Thank you very much to the investors who have already started with us.  Your support means the world to these Queen Bees!


Tracy and Karen


Product:

The Hive Butler is a clear, food-grade storage dream-come-true for beekeepers to use bringing in honey frames, storing newly built frames and even for short-term moving of bees on the frame!  There are two different lid designs: a solid lid for storage and moving, and a screen-top for use with live bees.   The Hive Butler is designed to hold 10 deep frames.  Obviously, it can hold mediums or shallows, as needed.

This early engineer's rendering  doesn't show that the Hive Butler will be clear, so you can tell whether it is loaded or ready to go.


The Problem:
Beekeepers have been working shorthanded for too long!  Bringing in honey is hot, messy, and dirty.  It doesn't have to be all of those, except maybe the hot part.  
As we started pulling those absolutely beautiful frames from our hives, we didn't really know how to protect them to get them home.  Most beekeepers just pull the wooden "super."  Early on, we did that.  The problems? Finding spare supers.  If we did find one, wood ware is dirty, heavy, painted, and there is NO BOTTOM in those boxes! The frames can actually fall out the bottom while you carry them.  Damage, grass, filth and LEAKAGE!  In the car, on the counter, everywhere.  If you can't extract immediately, then what?  Ants, mess, loss.  The need for a better box became very evident. 

That awful leaning means damage and loss.

                                       

Coolers are very little help. Nothing holds the frames. Lost honey fills the bottom.

We had spent a lot of money  getting our bee yards established, and so every tablespoon of honey spilling anywhere was a leak from our wallets, so to speak.  So, we started using coolers.  That helped, some.  We were able to keep the bees out, and the mess contained.  But once the honey was laying in the bottom of the cooler, it was lost to us.  Can't sell it.  Can't really eat it.   And every time we moved the coolers in the yards, the frames would fall on one another, and gouge open, spilling our "money" into the cooler.   We would look at each other, and say, "There needs to be a box just for this."  Every clunk we heard in the cooler was a smack on the head to come up with a better design.  When we found ourselves saying, "There should be a box for this," ten times in a day, we just decided we would be the ones to do it!


Oh no! Lost honey!  What a mess, and what happens to that gold on the bottom?

                                        

Is this how you store your frames?! Surely there is a better way?


The Solution:
We started discussing our ideas more seriously, and soon realized "the box" could have several uses for the beekeepers: 
  • 1. Honey harvest.  Keeping your honey SAFE, from damage, dirt and insects, in a food-grade storage box.
  • 2. Storage and toting new frames, safely, cleanly, without pulling an important (and heavy) wood hive box out of service. 
  • 3.  Transporting frames with bees!  As summer progressed and we had beekeeping to do, we had lots of frame moving that had to be done between hives.  Sometimes, simple moving, sometimes more stressful searching for queens.  Worrying about losing Her Royal Highness out the bottom of a box, or out the top while we're looking away.  We figured "the box" could have a screen top for use during that kind of field work as well. 

The Hive Butler will hold up to 10 deep frames, and is designed to carry up to 75 lbs. 
As our bee yards expanded, we had to become more self-reliant with hive ware.  Once we started assembling our own frames, we learned the importance of proper storage and handling of frames with wax foundation.  They can't be laid flat.  They shouldn't be dropped or jumbled.  Because we were expanding, it seemed like we never had an empty, available wooden hive box of the proper size to hold the frames for us.  We were always using fruit boxes from Costco, or storage totes and those were never quite right.
When we realized the multiple uses, no matter how big or small your beeyard, we decided it was time to really try to get it going.  It was a viable, worthwhile produce for anyone who keeps bees.
Amazingly, we knew someone whose son is a plastics design engineer.  Once we had a working set of drawings and a bit of education in plastics manufacture,  we began to understand the level of investment, and fortitude required to bring a product to market.  But our belief in the need for and value of the box hasn't wavered.

The awareness of beekeeping, and the value of bees to our food supply and economy is growing exponentially.  It's on magazine covers, in newspapers, tv and even grocery store labels.  Beekeeping is a necessity--and this storage box will help beekeepers, big or small, every single time they work hives.  And, it will work for them, even while they sleep!  Keeping frames new, or ready-to-be-extracted, safe and clean til the right time.

We call it the "HIVE BUTLER!"  For clean-up, protection, storage, and transport, the ultimate storage box has your back!  No more damaged frames.  No more drippy mess, or honey lost in the bottom of a cardboard box. 

Store your newly-built frames; tote them to the yard.  Keep your heavy woodware working for you, on the hive.  Fill the Hive Butler full, and you'll be able to tell at a glance which ones are ready to go.  Need to move bees?  Don't worry about losing HRH in transit.  And don't be lugging those 10-frame deeps!
The Hive Butler.  
Designed by beekeepers, for beekeepers.  Working, even when you're not. 

This is an early design of the screen top.

We designed the Hive Butler to hold 10 deep frames.  We know most honey isn't in deep frames, but often there is more honey in the brood boxes than you would like.  We didn't want to design the box for medium frames, and then have no place for deeps!   We are recommending maximum weight of 75lbs. 



The Plan:
The quote to produce the mold for the Hive Butler, and the two lid options is just under $30,000.   There will also be set-up charges each time the mold is put into production.  Any additional funding monies will go toward production of the boxes, including labeling, and finally advertising.

We'd love to have your support!  Even if you can't contribute financially, spreading the story of the Hive Butler on your social media sites gives us more opportunities to bring this box to a bee school near you!


About  us...

Karen and I went to high school together way back when, and ran into each other about 30 years later.  We were amazed to find out we lived two miles apart, and each had only daughters, and horses and dogs.  We had both been active as 4H leaders, and we had both gone through breast cancer, one year apart. 

Karen talked me into driving a schoolbus with her, so we saw each other every day, twice a day.  I started saying we needed to go into some sort of business together, maybe even with our daughters.  And then, in the summer of 2013, she saw the rapid demand on FB for the honey I had just harvested from one of my beehives.  She suggested we go into "the bee business." 

Having both been in and around the horse industry for many years, we  understood a hobby where there is no end to learning and improving.  Once Karen got into a beehive, she was on fire--and having someone to work with re-inspired me to dig in further. 

We went to every bee school we could; joined organizations, read books, watched videos and even started a local beekeepers club in our area.  Spring 2014, we started with one hive that had overwintered, and closed out the year with 18.  We have done cut-outs, caught swarms, combined hives, found queens, requeened, done splits, grafted queens and enjoyed the glorious harvest of honey.  We now have over 30 hives in several beeyards, and serve on the boards of our state beekeeping organizations.

story:
ORDER GIFTS OF COFFEE & CHOCOLATE BY 20TH DEC 2015 AND WE'LL MAKE SURE PARCELS ARE DELIVERED BY CHRISTMAS EVE!!! 

(free delivery anywhere in Ireland)


About BeanTribe:

BeanTribe is a new subscription service for coffee and chocolate from communities in Africa.

Each month we deliver to your door, a bag of coffee and tasty bar of chocolate from different communities in Africa. It's trade not aid with over 3 times the impact of fair trade.

Why BeanTribe?

Africa grows some of the finest coffee and chocolate in the world but the majority of the produce is exported out of the continent as raw beans. Most of the production, packaging and roasting takes place elsewhere.

So when you and I typically drink coffee or enjoy a chocolate bar we help support just one job in an African community – that of the farmer.

With BeanTribe we sell coffee and chocolate that is grown and produced in Africa. This means we can support a multitude of jobs in developing communities: supporting local farmers, coffee roasters, chocolate makers, handlers, packers, drivers and entrepreneurs who can in turn help their families to thrive.

It's trade not aid with over 3 times the impact of fair trade.

Your Support:

With your help we aim to raise the seed funding to launch BeanTribe and fulfil our first customer orders. Your funds can help us:

  • Order the first batches of chocolate and coffee from producers in Africa
  • build version 1.0 of the BeanTribe.com online store
  • perfect the design packaging & branding
  • establish the delivery process from producers in Africa to the customer.
  • Share the stories of the producers in Africa and BeanTribe’s impact. 

What we Need:

Our goal with this campaign is to raise €12,000 and secure 100 subscriptions for coffee and chocolate for 2016. 

What You Get:

In return for your support, you will receive: 

  • monthly deliveries of great coffee and tasty chocolate
  • invitations to BeanTribe's launch event in 2016
  • access to special coffee and chocolate tasting workshops, 
  • personalized thank you notes and updates from our team and the producers across Africa

Your Impact:


Your support will get us started. It will help us create a tribe of coffee and chocolate fans and allow us to purchase the first shipments of coffee and chocolate that is  grown and made in Africa while helping sustain jobs in some  of the poorest communities on the continent.

Risks and Challenges:

This is a start up company, a new project with some healthy challenges:

  • We don’t know yet how large demand for BeanTribe might be - to figure this out we just need to out there selling!. 
  • Sourcing and establishing long term partnerships with quality coffee and chocolate producers across Africa will be crucial to our success
  • Ensuring delivery runs smooth is key: shipping from locations in Africa, packaging and delivering to our customers on time
  • We need to build a great online store – one that is super easy to use, inspiring and also totally secure for payment and credit cards. 
Other Ways You Can Help:


 Even if you can't fund us we'd love to get your support. Follow us on Facebook, share our page and our posts and please tell your friends about BeanTribe. To get things moving we just need to muster all the support we can : )

About Me:

For almost 15 years I’ve worked in the overseas aid sector: raising funds, visiting projects and meeting people living in poor communities across Africa. In this time I’ve come to learn that the best way we can help people out of poverty is through trade and employment. 

I'm also a big coffee and chocolate fan. Plus I happen to think getting a parcel in the post is much more fun than bills and bank statements. 

With BeanTribe I hope to combine these ideas and take you on a journey to explore the best coffees and chocolates Africa has to offer while helping to create and sustain meaningful jobs in some of the poorest communities on the continent.

Other Ways You Can Help:





 Even if you can't fund us we'd love to get your support. Follow us on Facebook, share our page and our posts and please tell your friends about BeanTribe. To get things moving we just need to muster all the support we can : )
About Me:

For almost 15 years I’ve worked in the overseas aid sector: raising funds, visiting projects and meeting people living in poor communities across Africa. In this time I’ve come to learn that the best way we can help people out of poverty is through trade and employment. 

I'm also a big coffee and chocolate fan. Plus I happen to think getting a parcel in the post is much more fun than bills and bank statements. 
With BeanTribe I hope to combine these ideas and take you on a journey to explore the best coffees and chocolates Africa has to offer while helping to create and sustain meaningful jobs in some of the poorest communities on the continent.

story:
Our Indigogo campaign is over but you can still contribute to make our vision a reality on our website at:  www.kbfpc.ca/supporters/

Creating a New Reality… Now!

Let’s make something extraordinary happen and build a resilient future for agriculture and our local farmers in the Southeastern region of British Columbia.  The Kootenay & Boundary Food Producers Co-op is passionate about increasing agricultural production and access to healthy local food in our stores, restaurants and local food processors.

The Status Quo

Droughts, climate change and the cost of oil, as well as the increasing awareness of the negative health impacts of processed foods  demand that we change our dependence on the current system. How can we be aware and NOT thirst for change?

The Co-op’s Plan

We have done the studies and mapped the needs.  We are creating an infrastructure to support farmer members in ways to stay on their farms longer and grow more by providing auxiliary services that supports growth and production capacity. Local food processor members will be supported with facilities and distribution that create more jobs and retain more $$ in the region. More then 5 different regional studies have shown that this work is critical to the ability of farmers in the Kootenays to make a living growing food. We are working with other food organizations in the area to ensure we compliment and work together cooperatively.

Help us Gain the Momentum!

Funds raised will support the Market Distribution & Storage Campaign in 2016.  Following on our successful pilot in 2015, we will expand the distribution region with:

  • A weekly market distribution service with a hired coordinator to set-up and implement plans, communications and the operations & logistics required to sell and distribute farmer members food to customers; stores, restaurants and food production processors.
  • A storage facility to warehouse food. Neither farmers nor stores have long-term storage capacity which means crops have to be ‘dumped’ at the lowest cost when they are harvested. Storage enables a longer sales window of local food – EG: storing and selling local squash after the ‘season has ended’ at a reasonable price.

Members say...

Grower members who participated in the 2015 Summer pilot talk about why the KBFPC is so important:


Your investment means a new tomorrow for local food sustainability!


Please Donate Today!

story:
Help us build the first DIY Vert Ramp for Skateboarders in Mumbai (India). 

“SKATEBOARDERS UNITED ASSOCIATION” reg no E-31281(Mumbai, India) is a registered Non profit organisation of which the website will be live by next week (www.skateboardersunitedassociation.org).    Our objective is to promote the sport of skateboarding by building infrastructure for the sport. This is our SkateMumbai initiative where we are building a DIY Vert ramp for the skateboarding community here in Mumbai. 

In Mumbai the current scenario is that there are lots of kids skateboarding but they are skating on roads in malls parking lots and they get shoeed away by guards etc. We have been building a 12 ft high wooden ramp which is a massive wooden ramp for kids and young skateboarders to come and skate there. Anyhow we are now facing a problem as the funds we raised for building this ramp wasn't enough. we are falling short of money required to purchase Flexi Plywood for the surface area. The size of the ramp is 12ft.(Ht) X 55 ft(Lh) X 30ft. (Width). The amount of flexi plywood sheets of 8X4 size required to cover this area is approximately 90 sheets of the thickness 12mm. Since this is the first Vert ramp in India and we have managed to have done it so far, we need to raise some funds of approximately $6000 to purchase these plywood sheets along with Spar Urethane to coat these sheets with protection to make it last for years to come. Also put the branding on the ramp. Any help will be much appreciated. It is a non profit organisation.

Spread the Stoke

Disclaimer :- These are actual site photos. 
All donations are routed through Skateboarders United Association which is a not for profit organisation and this campaign is the Skate Mumbai Initiative.

story:
Short Summary

On any given night, over 11,000 individuals are experiencing homelessness in North Carolina. Approximately 40% of those individuals are also experiencing a serious mental illness.

As high as these numbers are, they only represent that fraction of the population that meet HUD criteria for “literally homeless” and only document a mental illness if the individual is currently receiving services. The statistics do not include those individuals who are not receiving treatment, are living in unidentifiable locations, or are not homeless, but are living in unsafe and substandard dwellings and are often at high risk for becoming homeless. 

The statistics do not reflect the number of individuals with disabilities who are living off of Supplemental Security Income, do not have a housing voucher, and face the reality of possible homelessness everyday. 

In North Carolina, 146,804 individuals with disabilities receive Supplemental Security Income (SSI). The average SSI for an individual with a disability is $721 a month. To rent a one-bedroom studio apartment in this state at the average fair market rate would cost an individual over 102% of their income. 

The Technical Assistance Collaborative, in a recent report on the housing crisis for individuals with disabilities stated “in 2014, it was impossible for a single adult anywhere in the country receiving SSI to obtain decent and safe housing in the community unless they had some type of permanent rental subsidy.” This is a crisis that deprives hundreds of thousands of people with disabilities of a basic human need: A place of their own to call home.

For individuals who are experiencing mental illness, housing insecurity not only deprives them of shelter from the elements, it imposes an extraordinary hurdle to the rehabilitative process. Homelessness exacerbates illness, and creates a psychological environment in which recovery, in any form, is next to impossible.

Which is why, at Penny Lane, we view housing as healthcare. 

Our vision at the Farm is to assist individuals living with mental health challenges to find a way to become self-sufficient and have an improved quality of life. One of the ways we can do that is to offer a housing solution that is affordable, energy efficient, and located in a supportive community environment. A tiny home community on the Penny Lane campus offers a practical solution to the life of chronic homelessness and isolation experienced by many individuals with mental illness.

Tiny homes can be defined as homes that do not exceed 500 square feet. They are far less expensive than traditional homes in terms of taxes, building, heating, maintenance, and repair costs. Living in a tiny home also encourages a less cluttered and simpler lifestyle and minimizes ecological impacts.

The Tiny Home Community project at Penny Lane is designed to evolve over three phases of development. Phase I is a pilot home on the campus that will serve as a research site for internally selected clients to experience living in a small space for a brief period of time. We hope to develop an understanding of the benefits and the challenges that living within 336 square feet may pose for potential residents. The data collected from this project will be used to inform Phase II, which is the development of a community of five tiny homes on the Penny Lane Campus. 

At this time, the focus of the research will shift from studying the viability of living in a small space, to that of living in an intentional community. Data collected from Phase II will inform the development of our third phase, the building of a final cluster of five tiny homes on the Penny Lane campus.

This project, which was only a concept last March, has captured the interest and support of a number of like-minded organizations in Chatham County. Together, we formed the Tiny House Community Collaborative and the construction of our first house, our pilot tiny home, began at the Chatham County Fair on September 8. We expect to welcome our first research participant into the home in March of 2016. 

The house itself is 336 square feet, and is a passive active solar house. It has a bedroom, a living room with a propane fireplace, a kitchenette complete with a stove, refrigerator and kitchen sink, and a bathroom with a toilet, shower, and combination washer/dryer. The cost of this home to the resident will be $250/month, and that includes all basic utilities.

Individuals who donate to this campaign will be helping to outfit the home with furniture and appliances that have been recommended by a team at the UNC School of Occupational Sciences. Seventy-five percent of the funds raised will be used to purchase and install flooring, energy efficient appliances, furniture, and cabinetry. Remaining funds will be used to cover Kickstarter fees, donor gifts, and consultant wages.

This campaign is an opportunity for individuals to be a part of an effort to create a better community for North Carolina's most vulnerable citizens. It allows donors to contribute to an innovative, collaborative project that supports the growth of our society and builds connection to the loved ones in our lives who are experiencing adversity due to mental illness. 

At Penny Lane, we embrace the idea of community as the primary therapeutic factor that provides resolution to social isolation; and supportive housing as the solid foundation from which meaningful recovery can begin. The addition of fresh food, purposeful work opportunities, and access to therapeutic services make this model one that we believe will have a life changing impact for individuals diagnosed with mental illness, and become a model that can be replicated across the country and around the world.

Who wouldn't want to be a part of that?


What We Need & What You Get

Funds raised in this campaign will be used to purchase

  • flooring and cabinetry ($3,000)
  • bathroom equipment and accessories ($1,500)
  • furniture ($5,000)
  • an energy efficient refrigerator and washer/dryer ($3,000)
  • induction range ($2,000)
  • front porch building materials and construction fees ($5,000)
  • development fees ($1,500)
  • additional proceeds will be used to fund the building of new homes in the tiny house community 

The Impact

Understanding the Affordability Gap

  • Approximately 40,000 people with mental illness reside in state mental institutions
  • over 200,000 non-elderly people with disabilities reside in nursing homes
  • over 863,000 individuals with disabilities live with care givers who are over 60 years old
  • many adults with disabilities are forced to choose between homelessness or being placed in a restrictive institutional setting
Our hope in this campaign is not only to raise funds to complete the first phase of our project, but also to obtain support and generate awareness about mental illness. What we are asking you to consider is more than just four walls and a roof. We are asking you to consider the concept of community. A concept that could alter the personal narratives of the most vulnerable members of our community, individuals who are our friends, our mothers, fathers, sisters, brothers, our daughters, and our sons. 

Risks & Challenges

Tiny homes are relatively new to the residential housing landscape. As such, there are discrepancies among county planning departments with regards to permitting and zoning. Fortunately, in Chatham County, the environmental planning department recognizes the value and potential impact of the Tiny Home project and has committed to working with us to strategize and develop solutions to any barriers that we may experience as we grow our community. We have participated in pre-application meetings, have given tours and discussed our project at length with all five of the Chatham County Commissioners, we participate in community events with our neighboring housing developments, and engage in conversations with surrounding counties to keep ourselves aware of progressions and challenges experienced in our region. We understand that we have a lot of work to do to, but feel very fortunate to have the support of our local municipalities.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, and we get that! Please consider helping out by

  • Getting the word out about our project!!
  • Sharing our campaign information with anyone and everyone who will listen!!
  • Using the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Maximizing the social marketing opportunity provided by Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram!!
  • Sharing some more!
  • And then sharing again!
  • Continuing to share!
  • Did I mention sharing? Please share! 

And that's all there is to it.
